original: mtshan gzhi lta bur mtshon pas na //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi lta bur mtshon pas na //
translated: Since it is illustrated by the basis of characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid bzhi par bzhed pa yin //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bzhi par bzhed pa yin //
translated: The characteristic is accepted as the fourth.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: gang ngo bo nyid kyang mtshan nyid bzhi par 'dod do //
analyzed: gang ngo bo nyid kyang mtshan nyid bzhi par 'dod do //
translated: That which is the essence is accepted as the fourth characteristic.

original: de ni rnam pa bcu drug ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bcu drug ste /
translated: That is sixteenfold.

original: de yang las su bsgrubs nas mtshan nyid de mtshon par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mtshan gzhi zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang las su bsgrubs nas mtshan nyid de mtshon par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mtshan gzhi zhes gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, since that characteristic is illustrated by having been accomplished as an object, it is called the basis of characteristics.

original: bshad pa gzhan yang gsungs pa la /
analyzed: bshad pa gzhan yang gsungs pa la /
translated: Another explanation is stated:

original: mtshan gzhi zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang ldan pas mtshan gzhi ste /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang ldan pas mtshan gzhi ste /
translated: The so-called basis of characteristics is the basis of characteristics because it possesses characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of possessing characteristics is called the characteristic.

original: ji ltar bcu drug gi bdag nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bcu drug gi bdag nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the nature of sixteen?

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs rtags dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽de'i phyir 'di'i skabs rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs rtags dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / de'i phyir 'di'i skabs rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The signs of affliction,” and so on.

original: rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, in this context, Subhūti said, “The perfection of wisdom is profound,” up to “it has the nature of being profound.”

original: spyad pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug srung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: spyad pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug srung bar byed pa'o //
translated: The practice is the protection of the six perfections.

original: spyad pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: spyad pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that practice?

original: gang 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa @142b la ;
analyzed: gang 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa @142b la ;
translated: He said, “It is this” and so on.

original: ngo bo nyid ji lta bu zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni ngo bo nyid zhus pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ji lta bu zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni ngo bo nyid zhus pa'o //
translated: The word “what” asks about the essence.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni len no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni len no //
translated: The Blessed One said and so on is the answer.

original: 'dul ba ni tshul ma yin pa de 'dul bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba ni tshul ma yin pa de 'dul bar 'os pa'o //
translated: Discipline is the proper taming of improper conduct.

original: de dag la 'dis rnam par dben pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pas na de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: de dag la 'dis rnam par dben pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pas na de skad ces brjod do //
translated: Since they have the nature of seclusion, they are called that.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni ngo bo nyid bzhi brjod do //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni ngo bo nyid bzhi brjod do //
translated: This much explains the four essences.

original: nyon mongs pas dben pa dang / rtags kyis dben pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i mtshan mas dben pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen pos dben pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas dben pa dang / rtags kyis dben pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i mtshan mas dben pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen pos dben pa'o //
translated: Seclusion from afflictions, seclusion from signs, seclusion from the signs of afflictions, and seclusion from the discordant factors and antidotes.

original: de la nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: Among them, afflictions are attachment and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rtags ni nyon mongs pas byas pa'i lus la sogs pa'i gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rtags ni nyon mongs pas byas pa'i lus la sogs pa'i gnas ngan len no //
translated: The sign of the afflictions is the negative reflex actions of body, etc.🔽The objective support of the afflictions is the five grasping heaps.

original: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma ni /🔽tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma ni / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The causal support of the afflictions is the six sense fields.🔽The objective support of the antidotes is the same as that of the afflictions.🔽The causal support of the antidotes is the same as that of the afflictions.🔽The sign of the antidotes is the absence of the sign of the afflictions.🔽The essential nature of the antidotes is the absence of the essential nature of the afflictions.

original: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po ni 'dod chags dang 'dod chags bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug dang gti mug med pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po ni 'dod chags dang 'dod chags bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug dang gti mug med pa'o //
translated: The non-conducive side and the conducive side are desire and freedom from desire, hatred and the absence of hatred, delusion and the absence of delusion.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti said, etc.,

original: rten du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
analyzed: rten du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
translated: up to “it becomes a support.”

original: 'di nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni rten te gang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ston par 'gyur ba ni sems can rnams kyi rten du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni rten te gang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ston par 'gyur ba ni sems can rnams kyi rten du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The essential nature of this is the support. Having fully awakened to it, he teaches it as the support for sentient beings.🔽Subhūti said, etc.,

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /🔽sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /🔽sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
translated: up to “the Buddha.”

original: 'dir gzugs la sogs pa dang 'brel pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzugs la sogs pa dang 'brel pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, “not related to form, etc.”

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: means that form, etc. do not exist inherently.

original: gang yang byang chub kyi don du gzugs la sogs pa'i don du yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang yang byang chub kyi don du gzugs la sogs pa'i don du yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Not for the sake of form, etc.”

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams kyi don thams cad kyi don du ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams kyi don thams cad kyi don du ma yin no //
translated: means that form, etc. do not exist inherently for the sake of any object.

original: de bzhin du gang yang byang chub kyi don dus gsum gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang yang byang chub kyi don dus gsum gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin /
translated: Similarly, “enlightenment is not the reality of the three times.”

original: byang chub gsum gyi ngo bo nyid sems can rnams kyi don du yang ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub gsum gyi ngo bo nyid sems can rnams kyi don du yang ma yin no //
translated: “Enlightenment is not the reality of the three times for the sake of beings.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
translated: “Why is that?” is the question.

original: rab 'byor kye ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan te re bar mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni thob pa med pa nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor kye ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan te re bar mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni thob pa med pa nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, alas!” and so on is the answer. “Do not hope for it” means that one should see that it is not attained.

original: de'i phyir gsum la blta bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsum la blta bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not see it as the three.

original: de bzhin du gnas par blta bar bya'o zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas par blta bar bya'o zhes dgongs so //
translated: One should see it as abiding in that way. This is the intended meaning.

original: 'di ni dka' ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni dka' ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: This is the nature of difficulty.

original: dka' ba dang bcas pa'i nges pa ni dka' ba dang nges pa'o //
analyzed: dka' ba dang bcas pa'i nges pa ni dka' ba dang nges pa'o //
translated: The certainty that is difficult is difficult certainty.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang zhes bya ba nas @143a * //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang zhes bya ba nas @143a * //
translated: Having been thus addressed, he said...

original: ma yin gyi bar du gsungs pa la /
analyzed: ma yin gyi bar du gsungs pa la /
translated: up to...

original: mngon par 'dod pa na don gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa na don gyi dbang ngo //
translated: When one desires this, the meaning is the power.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis gnas ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis gnas ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: And that is stated by the Lord himself, beginning with It is not possible.

original: sangs rgyas kyis nyid la nges pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis nyid la nges pa'o //
translated: The certainty is in the Buddha himself.

original: 'on kyang gang gis sems can thams cad kyi don du go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya ba ni ched du bya ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gis sems can thams cad kyi don du go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya ba ni ched du bya ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: But rather, it is the one who has girded on the great armor for the sake of all beings, is the nature of the purpose.🔽Subhūti said...

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: up to...

original: brtag par bya zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la zab mo zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: brtag par bya zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la zab mo zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
translated: should be investigated. The profound is the thesis.

original: 'og ma bzhis ni gtan tshigs te bsgom pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'og ma bzhis ni gtan tshigs te bsgom pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: The four below are the reasons: because of the non-apprehension of meditation,

original: dus gsum du bsgom pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / bsgom par bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dngos po mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / de'i dmigs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum du bsgom pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / bsgom par bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dngos po mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / de'i dmigs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meditation is not perceived in the three times, because the entity of the perfection of wisdom which is to be meditated upon is not perceived, and because its object is not perceived.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i lan bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dris so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i lan bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dris so //
translated: In order to demonstrate the response to the objection that the reason is unestablished, he asks:

original: ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni lan te yongs su grub pa'i dngos por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni lan te yongs su grub pa'i dngos por gyur pa'o //
translated: because of non-existence. The response is: because of the perfected entity.

original: nam mkha' sgom pa 'di ni chos thams cad mi bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' sgom pa 'di ni chos thams cad mi bsgom pa ste /
translated: This meditation on space is the non-meditation of all dharmas,

original: chos nyid tsam mthong ba'i phyir dang / chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid tsam mthong ba'i phyir dang / chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the mere perception of the dharmata, and because of the non-perception of all dharmas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ma chags pa bsgom pa dang / mtha' yas pa bsgom pa 'di ni chos thams cad la thogs pa med cing mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ma chags pa bsgom pa dang / mtha' yas pa bsgom pa 'di ni chos thams cad la thogs pa med cing mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For this very reason, this meditation on non-attachment and on the infinite is because of the unobstructedness and infinity of all dharmas.

original: dngos po ma mchis pa bsgom pa ni gzung ba mi dmigs pa bsgom pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa bsgom pa ni gzung ba mi dmigs pa bsgom pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The meditation on the non-existence of an entity is because of the very meditation on the non-perception of the apprehended.

original: yongs su bzung ba ma mchis pa bsgom pa de ni 'dzin pa mi dmigs par bsgom pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba ma mchis pa bsgom pa de ni 'dzin pa mi dmigs par bsgom pa'i phyir te /
translated: That cultivation of the absence of appropriation is the cultivation of the non-apprehension of grasping,

original: nye bar brtag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar brtag par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be known as an investigation.

original: 'di ni mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: This is the nature of non-apprehension.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba nas mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mngon par zhen pa bkag pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba nas mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mngon par zhen pa bkag pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Subhūti, from “the bodhisattva mahāsattva” up to “because it does not make distinctions,” is the nature of the negation of attachment.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
translated: Subhūti said, from “the perfection of wisdom” up to “the knowledge of all aspects,”

original: bye brag tu brtags pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'o ;
analyzed: bye brag tu brtags pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'o ;
translated: “investigation” is the object of apprehension.

original: / gzhol ba dang / 'bab pa dang / bab pa'i sgra ni gzhi'i don to //
analyzed: / gzhol ba dang / 'bab pa dang / bab pa'i sgra ni gzhi'i don to //
translated: The words “inclined,” “flowing,” and “descending” have the meaning of basis.

original: de dag dang lhan cig 'bru mang por bya'o //
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig 'bru mang por bya'o //
translated: They should be used together with many grains.

original: sems kyi rgyud ni rgyun no //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud ni rgyun no //
translated: The continuum of mind is the stream.

original: nam mkha' la gzhol ba zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' la gzhol ba zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Inclined to space” is because it is like space.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'di bye brag tu brtags pa @143b ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'di bye brag tu brtags pa @143b ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is the perfection of wisdom, which is a specific analysis of omniscience.

original: de ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' lta bu nyid de ga las she na'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' lta bu nyid de ga las she na'o //
translated: Why is it so? Why is it like space?

original: rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan no //
analyzed: rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan no //
translated: The answer is given by Subhuti, etc.

original: yul dang dus las dpag par mi nus pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang dus las dpag par mi nus pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: It is immeasurable because it cannot be measured by place or time.

original: de kho na bzhin du tshad dang bral pa'i phyir tshad med pa'o//
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du tshad dang bral pa'i phyir tshad med pa'o//
translated: It is unlimited because it is free from measure in the same way.

original: de ni gzugs nas phyogs gang du yang mi gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de ni gzugs nas phyogs gang du yang mi gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: It does not stand anywhere, from form up to the Buddhadharmas.

original: 'di dag thams cad la yul dang / dus kyis khyab pa'i tshad med pa'i phyir dang / gzugs can du mi rigs pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad la yul dang / dus kyis khyab pa'i tshad med pa'i phyir dang / gzugs can du mi rigs pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: It is immeasurable because it is not measured by place and time, and because it is not reasonable to suppose that it has form.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ni zhes bya ba dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ni zhes bya ba dang sbyor ro //
translated: Otherwise, etc.

original: sus kyang zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang gis kyang ste /
analyzed: sus kyang zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang gis kyang ste /
translated: “By anyone” means by any intrinsic reality of form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni tshad med pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni tshad med pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs so //
translated: The idea is that form, etc. are immeasurable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'o //
translated: “Why is that?” is the question.

original: rab 'byor gzugs nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is because form itself” and so on is the answer.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra ni 'dir chos nyid la brjod do ;
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra ni 'dir chos nyid la brjod do ;
translated: The words “form,” etc. here refer to reality.

original: / de'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: / de'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction.

original: gzugs la sogs pa tha dad kyang chos nyid ni tha dad pa ma yin te gzugs la sogs pa brdzun pa nyid kyis tha dad par byed na de'i tshe mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa tha dad kyang chos nyid ni tha dad pa ma yin te gzugs la sogs pa brdzun pa nyid kyis tha dad par byed na de'i tshe mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Although form, etc. are different, reality is not different. If form, etc. were made different by their falsity, then they would not appear.

original: 'di ni dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //🔽de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ni dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid do // de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: This is the nature of the object.

original: le'u rdzogs pa'i bar du gsungs pa la mos par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir zab pa'o //
analyzed: le'u rdzogs pa'i bar du gsungs pa la mos par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir zab pa'o //
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said, up to the end of the chapter. It is profound because it is difficult to believe.

original: gting dpag dka' ba ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis so //🔽blta dka' ba ni 'jig rten pa'i bsgoms pa las byung bas so //
analyzed: gting dpag dka' ba ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis so // blta dka' ba ni 'jig rten pa'i bsgoms pa las byung bas so //
translated: It is difficult to fathom by the wisdom born of reflection.🔽It is difficult to see by the wisdom born of meditation in the mundane path.

original: rtogs par dka' ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pas so //
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pas so //
translated: It is difficult to realize by the supramundane path.

original: brtson pa chung ba ni byed par mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: brtson pa chung ba ni byed par mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: Little effort is the unwillingness to act.

original: gzhol ba ni 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gzhol ba ni 'jug pa'o //
translated: Inclination is engagement.

original: gang du sus kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dus gsum gyi dgag pa'o //
analyzed: gang du sus kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dus gsum gyi dgag pa'o //
translated: By no one in the three times, etc. is the negation of the three times.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni las dgag pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni las dgag pa'o //
translated: By space, etc. is the negation of action.

original: chos thams cad ni thob pa'i 'ong ba med pa dang / dor ba'i 'gro ba med pa'i phyir zab po //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni thob pa'i 'ong ba med pa dang / dor ba'i 'gro ba med pa'i phyir zab po //
translated: All phenomena are profound because of the non-coming of attainment and the non-going of relinquishment.

original: mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log go //
analyzed: mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log go //
translated: Disagreeable means contrary.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir mi 'jug pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir mi 'jug pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Because of non-engagement due to non-conceptuality.

original: 'jig rten dag ni chos 'di 'dzin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag ni chos 'di 'dzin pa la spyod do //
translated: The world engages in the practice of grasping this dharma.

original: 'jig rten ni phyin ci log la nges shing rnam par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni phyin ci log la nges shing rnam par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the world is fixed and determined in error.

original: 'di ni mi mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni mi mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: This is the nature of the discordant.

original: brgya byin la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i le'u ni lha'i le'u'o //
analyzed: brgya byin la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i le'u ni lha'i le'u'o //
translated: The chapter that illustrates the gods, such as Indra, is the chapter on the gods.

original: @144a * // 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel /
analyzed: @144a * // 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel /
translated: Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines Commentary

original: slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u bco lnga pa'o /
analyzed: slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u bco lnga pa'o /
translated: By Master Ratnākaraśānti, the Heart of the Supreme, the fifteenth chapter.

original: // / de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: // / de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Then the Blessed One... and so on is stated.

original: 'di ni gang la yang thogs pa ma mchis zhes bya ba ni thams cad du gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni gang la yang thogs pa ma mchis zhes bya ba ni thams cad du gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, it is unobstructed in any way means that it is not harmed anywhere.

original: de'i phyir thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni thogs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni thogs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the characteristic of unobstructedness is the nature of unobstructedness.

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis nam mkha' dang 'dra bar de bzhin du rtogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis nam mkha' dang 'dra bar de bzhin du rtogs pa med pa'o //
translated: It is similar to space means that just as space is not cognized, so is this.

original: mtshungs pa de ga las she na /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ga las she na /
translated: From where is it similar?

original: de'i phyir gnas thams cad ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas thams cad ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “in all situations,”

original: dngos po thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all things are unobservable.

original: mtshungs pa ma mchis pa ni dpe med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa ma mchis pa ni dpe med pa'o //
translated: “Without compare” means without example.

original: gnyis su ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because of non-duality” means because of the absence of similarity.

original: 'di la gnod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa ni do zla'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di la gnod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa ni do zla'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: That which has the characteristic of being harmed here is the characteristic of an adversary.

original: de med pa'i phyir do zla ma mchis pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir do zla ma mchis pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Because of the absence of that, there is the characteristic of being without adversary.

original: rgol ba ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni 'gal bar byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgol ba ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni 'gal bar byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because of being without opposition” means because of the absence of contradiction.

original: 'di ni thogs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni thogs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: This is the nature of being unobstructed.

original: rjes su ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: rjes su ni bzhi ste /
translated: The following is fourfold:

original: bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro dang / mya ngan las 'das pa rnams so //
analyzed: bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro dang / mya ngan las 'das pa rnams so //
translated: good destinies, bad destinies, and nirvāṇa.

original: de med pa ni rjes med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni rjes med pa'o //
translated: The absence of that is the absence of a trace.

original: mngon par grub pa ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mngon par grub pa ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Because of non-establishment” means

original: mngon par grub pa med pa ni gang du yang gnas pa med do //
analyzed: mngon par grub pa med pa ni gang du yang gnas pa med do //
translated: because of non-establishment, there is no abiding anywhere.

original: ci'i phyir mngon par grub pa med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mngon par grub pa med pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it non-established?

original: gang gi phyir 'byung ba ma mchis pa ni 'byung ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'byung ba ma mchis pa ni 'byung ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: Because it is non-arisen, i.e., free from arising.

original: ci'i phyir 'byung ba med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'byung ba med pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it non-arisen?

original: skye ba thams cad skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba thams cad skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all arising is non-arising.

original: skyes zin pa yang skye ba'i mtshan nyid du rigs pa'i phyir dang / med pa yang med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: skyes zin pa yang skye ba'i mtshan nyid du rigs pa'i phyir dang / med pa yang med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: It is not reasonable that what has already arisen should have the characteristic of arising, nor that what is non-existent should have the characteristic of non-existence,

original: mi rigs te bong bu'i rva bzhin no //
analyzed: mi rigs te bong bu'i rva bzhin no //
translated: like the horn of an ass.

original: ngan 'gro'i lam dang / bde 'gro'i lam dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ni lam mo //
analyzed: ngan 'gro'i lam dang / bde 'gro'i lam dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ni lam mo //
translated: The path of the lower realms, the path of the higher realms, and the path of nirvana are paths.

original: de med pa ni lam med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni lam med pa'o //
translated: The non-existence of those is the non-existence of paths.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lam thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lam thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: For that very reason, it is said that all paths are non-apprehensible.

original: 'di ni gzhi med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhi med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: This is the nature of the groundless.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la rjes su mthun par skyes so zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i rjes su skyes pa ni byed pa dang ldan pa'i las so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la rjes su mthun par skyes so zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i rjes su skyes pa ni byed pa dang ldan pa'i las so //
translated: The phrase arose in conformity with means that the arising of the former is the action of the agent.

original: las skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: las skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: The action generates.

original: rjes su mthun pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ste /
translated: The conformity is the object of the action.

original: de'i phyir ka ta ni byed pa po'i rkyen @144b du bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ka ta ni byed pa po'i rkyen @144b du bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the kta affix is used to indicate the agent condition.

original: las kyi drug pas 'brel ba smra bar 'dod nas bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su mthun par skyes pa ni rab 'byor ro //
analyzed: las kyi drug pas 'brel ba smra bar 'dod nas bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su mthun par skyes pa ni rab 'byor ro //
translated: The Lord of the gods, Sakra, wishing to speak of the connection with the kta affix, said, Subhuti arose in conformity with the Lord.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni de de'i rjes su skyes pa ga las she na /🔽bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan gsungs te /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni de de'i rjes su skyes pa ga las she na / bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan gsungs te /
translated: Why is that? means, Why did he arise in conformity with him?

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis sras dang 'dra bar stong ba nyid smra ba'i phyir ro zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis sras dang 'dra bar stong ba nyid smra ba'i phyir ro zhes dgongs so //
translated: The Lord said, etc. means that the Lord himself said, Because he is a son of the Buddha, he speaks of emptiness.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la ma skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun par skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la ma skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun par skyes pa'o //
translated: Because of non-arising” means in accordance with arising.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs gsungs pa ni ma skyes pa nyid yin yang pha dang / bu gnyis su 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs gsungs pa ni ma skyes pa nyid yin yang pha dang / bu gnyis su 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes dgongs so //
translated: Thinking that, he says the reason: “Although non-arising, because of the similarity of father and son.”

original: gal te ma skyes na de nyid ji ltar pha dang bu 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ma skyes na de nyid ji ltar pha dang bu 'dra zhe na /
translated: If there is no arising, how can that be the similarity of father and son?

original: kun rdzob tu yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: Thinking that, he says “in the conventional.”

original: rjes su song ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs gzhan gsungs so //
analyzed: rjes su song ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs gzhan gsungs so //
translated: “In accordance” and so on state another reason.

original: rjes su song ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su song ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su song ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su song ba'o //
translated: “In accordance” means in accordance with the suchness of the Tathāgata.

original: de bas na yang rjes su skyes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su 'gro zhing skyes pa ni rjes su mthun par skyes pa'o zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: de bas na yang rjes su skyes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su 'gro zhing skyes pa ni rjes su mthun par skyes pa'o zhes dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, “arising” means arising in accordance with the Tathāgata, and “in accordance” means in accordance with arising.

original: gal te gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If you say that the reason is not established, then the passage beginning with “How?” is stated.

original: 'ongs pa yang med ces bya ba ni skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'ongs pa yang med ces bya ba ni skye ba med pa'o //
translated: “Nor does it come” means that it is not produced.

original: song ba yang med ces bya ba ni 'jig pa med pa'o //
analyzed: song ba yang med ces bya ba ni 'jig pa med pa'o //
translated: “Nor does it go” means that it is not destroyed.

original: yang ci dgra bcom pa nyid thob nas rjes su mthun par skyes sam /
analyzed: yang ci dgra bcom pa nyid thob nas rjes su mthun par skyes sam /
translated: Moreover, is it that one is born in accordance with the attainment of arhatship?

original: ci dang po nyid nas yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang po nyid nas yin zhe na /
translated: Or is it that one is so from the very beginning?

original: de'i phyir gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni dang po nyid nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni dang po nyid nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the passage beginning with “This elder Subhūti” is stated.

original: de bzhin nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de bzhin ni sgras brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de bzhin ni sgras brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “It is not suchness” means that suchness is not expressed by the word.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: “Thus” and so on concludes.

original: 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: “Going and not going” is going.

original: de bkag pa'i phyir 'gro ba med pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de bkag pa'i phyir 'gro ba med pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Because that is negated, it is the nature of non-going.

original: rjes su mthun par skyes pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: rjes su mthun par skyes pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: In order to teach another reason that is in accordance with that, he says, “The thusness of the tathāgatas,” and so on.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi chos rnams ni gnas pa ste 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi chos rnams ni gnas pa ste 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid gnas pa nyid do //
translated: The phenomena of thusness are “abiding” because they are not to be transcended.

original: gtan tshigs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: In order to teach another reason, he says, “Just as,” and so on.

original: snga ma'i rang gi ngo bo'i rjes su 'jug pa ni 'gyur ba med pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma'i rang gi ngo bo'i rjes su 'jug pa ni 'gyur ba med pa'o //
translated: The “unchanging” is the engagement with the former intrinsic reality.

original: rang gi ngo bo gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug pa ni rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'o //🔽rnam par rtog pa @145a * //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug pa ni rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'o // rnam par rtog pa @145a * //
translated: The “unmodified” is the engagement with another intrinsic reality.

original: med pa ni rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: med pa ni rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: The “nonconceptual” is the absence of conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: The “nonconceptual” is because it is not the domain of conceptualization and nonconceptualization.

original: gtan tshigs gzhan yang ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan yang ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Another reason is stated with “Just as,” and so on.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir gang yang thogs pa med pa'o ;
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir gang yang thogs pa med pa'o ;
translated: Because it does not go anywhere, it is unimpeded.

original: / de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni thams cad du thogs pa med pa ste ga las te /
analyzed: / de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni thams cad du thogs pa med pa ste ga las te /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar gang las 'ongs pa'i de bzhin nyid ni de na yod de de las gzhan na ni med pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang las 'ongs pa'i de bzhin nyid ni de na yod de de las gzhan na ni med pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: Because the thusness that comes from somewhere does not exist there, and does not exist elsewhere.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba nas gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis lan te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba nas gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis lan te /
translated: The reply is given by “the Tathāgata” up to “is not dual.”

original: 'di ni gcig ste zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gcig ste zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
translated: This is the thesis: “This is one.”

original: de rigs gcig pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de rigs gcig pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it one because it has one type?

original: gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He says “nondual.”

original: gnyis ni tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ni tha dad pa'o //
translated: Two is different.

original: de med pa ni gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: de med pa ni gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: The absence of that is nondual.

original: gcig gi sgra'i don to //
analyzed: gcig gi sgra'i don to //
translated: It is the meaning of the word one.

original: gal te gcig pa yin yang 'brel pa can tha dad pas tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gcig pa yin yang 'brel pa can tha dad pas tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is one, it is different because the related things are different.

original: dper na shar phyogs kyi nam mkha' dang / gzhan gyi nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shar phyogs kyi nam mkha' dang / gzhan gyi nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the space of the east and the space of the west.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi de bzhin nyid la sogs pa don tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi de bzhin nyid la sogs pa don tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Similarly, the suchness of form, the suchness of feeling, the suchness of perception, the suchness of volitional factors, and so on, would become different objects.

original: gnyis su byar med ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gnyis su byar med ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He says, “without making it into a duality,”

original: de'i phyir yang gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid ni rtag tu de kho na nyid du yod pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid ni rtag tu de kho na nyid du yod pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: and therefore, the suchness that is nondual is always just that suchness.

original: gnyis su med pa yang rang bzhin nyid tha dad pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan las kyang tha dad pa med pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa yang rang bzhin nyid tha dad pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan las kyang tha dad pa med pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Nonduality is suchness that is not different in terms of its intrinsic reality, and it is the suchness that is not different from anything else.

original: gang du yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs gsungs te /
analyzed: gang du yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs gsungs te /
translated: He states the reason with, “Nowhere at all,” and so on.

original: gang dang gang gi gzhi dang rgyu ni de dang de'i rgyur 'gyur te dper na khron pa'i chu dang / nas kyi myu gu lta bu'o zhe na de bzhin nyid ni gang du yang ma yin gang na yang ma yin te de'i phyir gang du yang 'brel pa med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gang dang gang gi gzhi dang rgyu ni de dang de'i rgyur 'gyur te dper na khron pa'i chu dang / nas kyi myu gu lta bu'o zhe na de bzhin nyid ni gang du yang ma yin gang na yang ma yin te de'i phyir gang du yang 'brel pa med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: But suchness is not anywhere, not anywhere at all. Therefore, because it is not related to anything anywhere,

original: gang gi yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi yang ma yin no //
translated: it is not anyone's.

original: gang gi phyir de gang yang ma yin pa de'i phyir de gnyis su byar med na gnyis su byar med pa'i de bzhin nyid yin pa de bas na thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de gang yang ma yin pa de'i phyir de gnyis su byar med na gnyis su byar med pa'i de bzhin nyid yin pa de bas na thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Since it is not anything, therefore it is not dual. Since it is nondual suchness, therefore it is unobstructed.

original: de bas na rab 'byor ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang rjes su mthun par skyes pa'o zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de bas na rab 'byor ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang rjes su mthun par skyes pa'o zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, Subhuti is born in accordance with the Tathagata. Thus it is established.

original: de ltar na gnas brtan zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs gzhan gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar na gnas brtan zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs gzhan gsungs pa la /
translated: Thus, in the passage beginning with the elder, another reason is stated.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni de gnyis gsungs @145b te ;
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni de gnyis gsungs @145b te ;
translated: Thus refers to the statement of those two.

original: ma byas pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni ma byas pa yang yin la rtag tu yod pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang yin pas na ma byas pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: ma byas pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni ma byas pa yang yin la rtag tu yod pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang yin pas na ma byas pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The phrase “non-arisen thusness” means that it is non-arisen and it is also thusness that exists eternally.

original: de ni nam yang de bzhin nyid ma yin te rtag tu de kho na nyid du 'gyur ro //🔽de bas na de ni gnyis su med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni nam yang de bzhin nyid ma yin te rtag tu de kho na nyid du 'gyur ro // de bas na de ni gnyis su med pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is never not thusness; it is always just thus.

original: dus tha dad pas kyang tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dus tha dad pas kyang tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is non-dual because it is not different at different times.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni las kyi gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni las kyi gnyis pa'o //
translated: The phrase “thusness of the Tathāgata” is the second action.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs gzhan gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs gzhan gsungs te /
translated: The phrase “just as it is” and so on states another reason.

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du'o //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du'o //
translated: The phrase “in every way” means in all world-realms.

original: chos thams cad du zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad du zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad pa'o //
translated: The phrase “in all things” means in all entities.

original: mi rtog pa ni de dag la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtog pa ni de dag la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is non-conceptual because it is free of conceptualization in regard to them.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni de nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni de nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-conceptuality is due to the very fact that all conceptualization is abandoned.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni thams cad la mi rtog pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa des so //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni thams cad la mi rtog pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa des so //
translated: Similarly, with regard to everything, by that non-conceptuality and non-discrimination.

original: gzhig tu med pa ni gcad du med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhig tu med pa ni gcad du med pa'o //
translated: Indestructible means indivisible.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu pa'o ;
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu pa'o ;
translated: Thus, etc. is the conclusion.

original: / ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs gzhan gsungs te /
analyzed: / ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs gzhan gsungs te /
translated: He states another reason with just as, etc.

original: gud na med do zhes bya ba ni gzhan du tha dad par mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gud na med do zhes bya ba ni gzhan du tha dad par mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Not elsewhere means not observed as different.

original: gnyis su med pa'i phyir 'di ni gzhan ma yin pa yang yin la de bzhin nyid kyang yin pas na gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i phyir 'di ni gzhan ma yin pa yang yin la de bzhin nyid kyang yin pas na gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Since it is non-dual, it is not other, and since it is suchness, it is the suchness of non-otherness.

original: de'i rjes su 'gro ba ni des kun rdzob tu de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su song ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro ba ni des kun rdzob tu de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su song ba'o //
translated: Its conformity is its conformity with the Tathagata in the conventional sense.

original: don dam pa ni 'di la gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: don dam pa ni 'di la gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
translated: The ultimate is stated with in this, there is no, etc.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni 'di la rjes su 'gro ba ni rab 'byor ram gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni 'di la rjes su 'gro ba ni rab 'byor ram gang yang med do //
translated: Here, “in this” refers to the fact that Subhūti does not exist in this, i.e., in the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang du yang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: gang du yang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: “In any way” refers to the Tathāgata.

original: 'di la rjes su 'gro bas nye bar song ba'o /
analyzed: 'di la rjes su 'gro bas nye bar song ba'o /
translated: “In this” means in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar na gang zag dang chos la bdag med par mthong ba yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: de ltar na gang zag dang chos la bdag med par mthong ba yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: Thus, it is intended that one sees the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: The summary is stated in “Thus, etc.”

original: ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs gzhan gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs gzhan gsungs so //
translated: The statement of another reason is “How, etc.”

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: The summary is stated in “Thus, etc.”

original: 'di ni skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid do ;🔽/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ni skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid do ; / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba nas /
translated: This is the nature of non-production.

original: sangs rgyas pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
translated: The passage from “the suchness of the Tathāgata” up to “the suchness of the Buddha” is stated.

original: 'dir thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med par tha dad du mthong ba'i bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med par tha dad du mthong ba'i bkag pa yin no //
translated: Here, the reality of all is the negation of the view that it is both different and not different.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'di thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ni mi @146a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'di thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ni mi @146a * //
translated: The reality of all this form, etc.

original: dmigs pa'o // 'di ni mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid de bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // 'di ni mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid de bcu drug pa'o //
translated: is nonapprehension. This is the nature of nonapprehension, the sixteenth.

original: de bzhin nyid 'di'i bdag nyid chen po ni de 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid 'di'i bdag nyid chen po ni de 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The greatness of this reality is stated in the words “this is he,” etc.

original: gshegs pa ni shes pa'i don te /
analyzed: gshegs pa ni shes pa'i don te /
translated: “Tathāgata” is the meaning of “gone thus.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ni de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes dgongs so ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ni de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes dgongs so ;
translated: The Tathāgata is so called because he has gone thus.

original: /'di bstan pa na gang g-yo bar gyur pa de ni yang de bzhin gshegs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: /'di bstan pa na gang g-yo bar gyur pa de ni yang de bzhin gshegs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
translated: When this was taught, there was a trembling, and the Tathāgata said, “This is he,” etc.

original: ltas chen po drug gam bco brgyad du ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar g-yos pa nas kun du rab tu shig shig pa'i bar du gsungs pa la /
analyzed: ltas chen po drug gam bco brgyad du ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar g-yos pa nas kun du rab tu shig shig pa'i bar du gsungs pa la /
translated: The trembling was such that there were six or eighteen great portents, and it is said that there was a trembling, and a great trembling, and a violent trembling, and so forth up to a universal and total trembling.

original: 'dir gsum ni g-yo ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir gsum ni g-yo ba'i don to //
translated: Here, three are the meaning of trembling.

original: gsum ni sgra'i don te drug gis khyab pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por byas pa'i dbye bas ltas chen po bco brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsum ni sgra'i don te drug gis khyab pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por byas pa'i dbye bas ltas chen po bco brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: The eighteen great signs are made by the divisions of the small, medium, and great pervasion by the six.

original: de la g-yos pa ni phyogs gcig las so //🔽'gul ba ni thams cad las so //
analyzed: de la g-yos pa ni phyogs gcig las so // 'gul ba ni thams cad las so //
translated: Among them, shaking is from one side.🔽Quaking is from all.

original: kun nas 'gul ba ni ldeg pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas 'gul ba ni ldeg pa'o //
translated: Trembling is from all directions.

original: chem chem ni dbyug pas bsnun pa'i khar ba bzhin no //
analyzed: chem chem ni dbyug pas bsnun pa'i khar ba bzhin no //
translated: Roaring is like a blow from a club.

original: 'ur 'ur ni sgra'o //
analyzed: 'ur 'ur ni sgra'o //
translated: Rumbling is a sound.

original: shig shig ni 'brug sgra chen po bzhin no //
analyzed: shig shig ni 'brug sgra chen po bzhin no //
translated: Shaking is like a great thunder.

original: rnam pa drug ni dper na sa'i shar phyogs mthon na nub phyogs dma'/
analyzed: rnam pa drug ni dper na sa'i shar phyogs mthon na nub phyogs dma'/
translated: The six aspects are, for example, if the east of the earth is high, the west is low.

original: nub phyogs mtho na shar phyogs dma' ba dang / lho phyogs mtho na byang phyogs dma' ba dang / byang phyogs mtho na lho phyogs dma' ba dang / dbus mtho na mtha' dma' ba dang / mtha' mtho na dbus dma' ba'o //
analyzed: nub phyogs mtho na shar phyogs dma' ba dang / lho phyogs mtho na byang phyogs dma' ba dang / byang phyogs mtho na lho phyogs dma' ba dang / dbus mtho na mtha' dma' ba dang / mtha' mtho na dbus dma' ba'o //
translated: If the west is high, the east is low. If the south is high, the north is low. If the north is high, the south is low. If the center is high, the end is low. If the end is high, the center is low.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: It is said, “at that time,” and so on.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par sangs rgyas bzhin du rab 'byor gyis de bzhin nyid bstan pa na ltas chen po bco brgyad byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par sangs rgyas bzhin du rab 'byor gyis de bzhin nyid bstan pa na ltas chen po bco brgyad byung ngo //
translated: Thus, just as the Tathagata has attained full enlightenment, Subhuti, when he taught reality, there were eighteen great signs.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang mnyam par bstan pa ni gzhan yang gnas brtan zhes bya ba nas mi dmigs zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang mnyam par bstan pa ni gzhan yang gnas brtan zhes bya ba nas mi dmigs zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
translated: In another way also he teaches their equality: Furthermore, the Elder Subhuti, etc.

original: nye bar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: nye bar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: to: does not review.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni rang gi chos kyis so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni rang gi chos kyis so //
translated: By means of his own Dharma,

original: rjes su skye ba ni byed pa po'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su skye ba ni byed pa po'i don to //
translated: he is born after, i.e. he is the agent.

original: gang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos so //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos so //
translated: The Dharma of the Tathagata,

original: rjes su skye ba ni las so //
analyzed: rjes su skye ba ni las so //
translated: he is born after, i.e. the action.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: Thus, he concludes.

original: ji ltar de bzhin nyid spyad par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin nyid spyad par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one course in the Dharmahood of the Tathagata?

original: gnas skabs de tsam gyis so //
analyzed: gnas skabs de tsam gyis so //
translated: To that extent is the situation.

original: de nas de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa rtogs par sla'o //
translated: Then, “suchness” and so on are easy to understand.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni gal te yang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni gal te yang ngo //
translated: “ However” means “if, on the other hand.”

original: @146b sum cu rtsa gsum pa zhes bya ba ni bral ba'i don gyi lnga pa'o //
analyzed: @146b sum cu rtsa gsum pa zhes bya ba ni bral ba'i don gyi lnga pa'o //
translated: “ Thirty-three” is the fifth case, the dative.

original: bya de lus che ba nyid kyis nus par sems pa'o //
analyzed: bya de lus che ba nyid kyis nus par sems pa'o //
translated: “ He thinks he can” because of the great size of his body.

original: bar der sems pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang sa'i bar du sems pa'o //
analyzed: bar der sems pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang sa'i bar du sems pa'o //
translated: “ In between” means in the space between the earth and the sky.

original: 'di ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa 'di lta bu 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa 'di lta bu 'byung ba'o //
translated: “ What do you think?” means “such a thought occurs.”

original: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: / 'dir shes pa dang khyad par dang byed pa dang ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: / 'dir shes pa dang khyad par dang byed pa dang ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan nas /
translated: Here, having taught the characteristics of consciousness, distinction, function, and essence,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: the factors conducive to liberation of the bodhisattvas should be mentioned.

analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams de dang bral na dgra bcom pa thob pa'i rgyu bstan cing mtshon par bya ba de gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, if the bodhisattvas are separated from that, the cause of attaining the state of an arhat is taught and indicated. In order to clearly demonstrate that, it is said, Then Shariputra... and so forth.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bgyi zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad don dam par shes pa'i phyir dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mtshan ma med par sbyor bar byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bgyi zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad don dam par shes pa'i phyir dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mtshan ma med par sbyor bar byed pa'i don to //
translated: One should cultivate the perfection of wisdom means that in order to understand all phenomena ultimately, one should engage in the perfections such as generosity without conceptual characteristics.

original: thabs la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la ;
translated: Skillful means means

analyzed: de la thabs ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems rtag tu mi gtong ba dang / bsod nams thams cad byang chub tu yang dag par bsngo ba ste /

analyzed: de ni bsngo ba dang rjes su yi rang ba'i le'u bstan to //
