translated: all sentient beings would be like that from the very beginning.

original: de'i phyir bsgrubs pas thob pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrubs pas thob pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is attained through practice.

original: de yang thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rtul pho gang dag yin pa de dag la ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: de yang thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rtul pho gang dag yin pa de dag la ni med do zhe na /
translated: And that is not for those who have the dullest form of the factors conducive to liberation.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba med pa'i phyir mi 'thob pas 'byung bar dka'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba med pa'i phyir mi 'thob pas 'byung bar dka'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is difficult to attain because it is not attained due to the absence of occurrence.

original: 'o na mngon par shes pa de dag gis thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa la sogs pa'i stobs kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ci'i phyir mi 'thob ce na /
analyzed: 'o na mngon par shes pa de dag gis thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa la sogs pa'i stobs kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ci'i phyir mi 'thob ce na /
translated: Well then, why is perfect complete enlightenment not attained through the power of hearing, contemplating, and meditating with those superknowledges?

original: rab 'byor yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Subhūti, because of being unreal, etc.”

original: de ni byis pas gzung ba'i don nyid byang chub tu sems na de yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / brdzun pa'i phyir thob pa ma yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: de ni byis pas gzung ba'i don nyid byang chub tu sems na de yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / brdzun pa'i phyir thob pa ma yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: He thinks: “If the very object grasped by the foolish were enlightenment, then it would not be attained because of being unreal and because of being false.”

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa la byang chub tu sems pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa la byang chub tu sems pa'am /
translated: Thus, the thought of enlightenment in regard to conceptual differentiation,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma la byang chub sems dpa'i phyogs gnyi ga rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma la byang chub sems dpa'i phyogs gnyi ga rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: or the thought of enlightenment in regard to the signs of conceptual differentiation, are both unreasonable for the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub la rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / byang chub rnam par rtog pas ma bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub la rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / byang chub rnam par rtog pas ma bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because enlightenment is free from conceptual differentiation and because enlightenment is not accomplished through conceptual differentiation.

original: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir rab 'byor rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir rab 'byor rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so ;
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, “Subhūti, because of being non-differentiative.”

original: / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnas brtan la sh'a ri'i bu'i lan no //
analyzed: / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnas brtan la sh'a ri'i bu'i lan no //
translated: Then, etc. is the reply of the elder Śāriputra.

original: de stong pa yin pa'i phyir mngon par 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs yin no snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: de stong pa yin pa'i phyir mngon par 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs yin no snyam du bsams nas /
translated: Because it is empty, this is a contradictory reason, thinking it is called 'going forth.'

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Having thought this, he said, Venerable Subhūti... and so on.

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs @147b pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs @147b pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is similar to space, and so on.

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: The reason is similar to space.

original: gang dag gang de kho na nyid de nyid kyis de dag mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par mi 'gyur ro zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: gang dag gang de kho na nyid de nyid kyis de dag mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par mi 'gyur ro zhes dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that those who are that suchness will not fully awaken to that suchness.

original: de ltar 'gal bar bstan nas rjes su dpag pas gnod pa smra bar 'dod nas thal bar 'gyur ba ni tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar 'gal bar bstan nas rjes su dpag pas gnod pa smra bar 'dod nas thal bar 'gyur ba ni tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Having thus shown the contradiction, wishing to state the refutation by inference, he said, If, Venerable Subhūti... and so on.

original: mi ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not a human.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bzlog ste gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bzlog ste gsungs so //
translated: He said the opposite, beginning with Because... and so on.

original: yang na 'di ni gzhan gyi gtan tshigs sun dbyung ba dang rang gi phyogs bsgrub pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na 'di ni gzhan gyi gtan tshigs sun dbyung ba dang rang gi phyogs bsgrub pa nyid do //
translated: Or else, this is the refutation of the opponent's reasoning and the establishment of our own position.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rab 'byor gyis thal ba rgya cher sel bar byed de /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rab 'byor gyis thal ba rgya cher sel bar byed de /
translated: Having said thus, etc., Subhūti extensively dispels the consequence.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir ldog pa ni yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba'i rnam par rtog pas so //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir ldog pa ni yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba'i rnam par rtog pas so //
translated: The turning away from perfect complete enlightenment is due to the discrimination of perfect complete enlightenment.

original: phyir ldog pa'i chos de gang yin zhes smras nas phyir mi ldog pa nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir de gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la ;
analyzed: phyir ldog pa'i chos de gang yin zhes smras nas phyir mi ldog pa nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir de gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la ;
translated: Having said what is that dharma which turns away? he says what is that? etc. in order to establish the very non-turning away.

original: chos thams cad la mi gnas pa'i tshul zhes bya ba la chos thams cad la mi gnas pa'i tshul ni rigs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mi gnas pa'i tshul zhes bya ba la chos thams cad la mi gnas pa'i tshul ni rigs pa'o //
translated: The method of non-abiding in all dharmas is the reasoning.

original: des na chos nyid la gnas pa med pa'i chos nyid kho na byang chub dag pa'o //
analyzed: des na chos nyid la gnas pa med pa'i chos nyid kho na byang chub dag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the very non-abiding in the nature of dharmas is the pure enlightenment.

original: de yang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes bsams so //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes bsams so //
translated: And that is also naturally pure, he thinks.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang zhes bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bu'i tshig ste /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang zhes bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bu'i tshig ste /
translated: Thus have I heard is the word of Śāriputra.

original: chos kyi tshul gyis rnam par zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi tshul gyis rnam par zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: By the method of Dharma is the aspect of the reality of phenomena.

original: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas khyad par gsungs te /
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas khyad par gsungs te /
translated: What is called etc. indicates a distinction.

original: yang gi sgra ni sgra'i don to //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni sgra'i don to //
translated: The word also has the meaning of sound.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa gang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gang pos rab 'byor la dran par byed do //🔽lhag ma rab 'byor bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa gang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gang pos rab 'byor la dran par byed do // lhag ma rab 'byor bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni /
translated: Then the venerable Pūrṇa and so on indicates that Pūrṇa reminds Subhūti.

original: byang chub tu nges par 'byung bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar glub  pa'i mtha' 'jog pa'i tshig ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: byang chub tu nges par 'byung bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar glub  pa'i mtha' 'jog pa'i tshig ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The remainder is the conclusion of the instruction, which is easy to understand, up to Subhūti, this bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as one who has set out for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir rgyas bar bstan pa dad ldan pa de yang chad kyis ni dbang po rnon po'i thar pa'i cha dang mthun pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'byung sla'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyas bar bstan pa dad ldan pa de yang chad kyis ni dbang po rnon po'i thar pa'i cha dang mthun pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'byung sla'o //
translated: Therefore, the one who has faith in the extensive teaching will easily attain perfect enlightenment through the aids to liberation of one of sharp faculties.

original: zhes thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bstan to //🔽thar pa'i cha ni bsten cing thob par bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bstan to // thar pa'i cha ni bsten cing thob par bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, the aids to liberation are taught.🔽The aids to liberation are the aids to the attainment of liberation.

original: de la phan pa ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: de la phan pa ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa ste /
translated: The aids to liberation are the aids to the attainment of liberation.

original: de dag bstan nas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa brjod par bya ste /🔽nges par 'byed pa ni so sor rtogs pa'i @148a * //
analyzed: de dag bstan nas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa brjod par bya ste / nges par 'byed pa ni so sor rtogs pa'i @148a * //
translated: Having taught the aids to liberation, he will now discuss the aids to penetration.

original: mthong ba'i lam mo //🔽de'i cha ni 'thob par bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam mo // de'i cha ni 'thob par bya'o //
translated: Penetration is the path of seeing that is the realization of the truths.

original: de la phan pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de la phan pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The aids to penetration are the aids to the attainment of penetration.

original: de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The aids to penetration are of four types:

original: drod dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / chos kyi mchog go //
analyzed: drod dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / chos kyi mchog go //
translated: heat, peak, forbearance, and the supreme mundane state.

original: de la dang po'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de la dang po'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: With regard to the first, the treatise attainment of knowledge states:

original: dro ba rnams kyi dmigs pa 'dir //
analyzed: dro ba rnams kyi dmigs pa 'dir //
translated: The object of the warm

original: sems can thams cad yin par bsngags //🔽de dag nyid la sems mnyam sogs //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yin par bsngags // de dag nyid la sems mnyam sogs //
translated: is said to be all sentient beings.🔽The ten aspects of the warm

original: rnam pa dag ni bcur bshad do //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pa dag ni bcur bshad do // zhes gsungs te /
translated: are explained as the equanimity of mind, etc.

original: de'i phyir de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān said, “From that time forth, I will be my own

original: bdag mgon du gyur par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
analyzed: bdag mgon du gyur par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
translated: refuge,” and so on, up to “I will be my own protector.”

original: gnas par bgyi zhes bya ba ni reg par bya bas so //
analyzed: gnas par bgyi zhes bya ba ni reg par bya bas so //
translated: “I will abide” means that I will touch.

original: bslab par bgyi zhes bya ba ni goms par bya bas so //
analyzed: bslab par bgyi zhes bya ba ni goms par bya bas so //
translated: “I will train” means that I will cultivate.🔽The ten aspects of the warm are explained by the words “I will abide in

original: mnyam par gnas par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems rnam pa bcu gsungs te /
analyzed: mnyam par gnas par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems rnam pa bcu gsungs te /
translated: equanimity,” etc.🔽They are the equanimity of mind, the mind of love, the mind of benefit,🔽the mind of non-deception, the mind of non-arrogance, the mind of non-

original: mnyam pa'i sems dang / byams pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems dang / g-yo ba med pa'i sems dang / nga rgya bcag pa'i sems dang / khong khro ba med pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / mtho btsams pa med pa'i sems dang /
analyzed: mnyam pa'i sems dang / byams pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems dang / g-yo ba med pa'i sems dang / nga rgya bcag pa'i sems dang / khong khro ba med pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / mtho btsams pa med pa'i sems dang /
translated: aversion, the mind of compassion, the mind of non-contempt, the mind of🔽non-violence, and the mind of non-harm.

original: ma dang pa la sogs pa'i sems dang / bu dang bu mo la sogs pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: ma dang pa la sogs pa'i sems dang / bu dang bu mo la sogs pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: the thought of mother, father, etc. , and the idea of son, daughter, etc.

original: mgon ni mgon dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: mgon ni mgon dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The protector is the one who has a protector.

original: de ni dro bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dro bar gyur pa'o //
translated: This is the state of heat.

original: bdag nyid sdig pa las ldog cing //
analyzed: bdag nyid sdig pa las ldog cing //
translated: One who has turned away from sin

original: sbyin la sogs la gnas pas gzhan //
analyzed: sbyin la sogs la gnas pas gzhan //
translated: and who is established in generosity, etc.🔽is to be established in them,

original: de dag la ni dgod pa dang // bsngags pa brjod dang mthun pa nyid //
analyzed: de dag la ni dgod pa dang // bsngags pa brjod dang mthun pa nyid //
translated: and is to be praised.

original: brtser gyur zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: brtser gyur zhes gsungs so //
translated: He is said to be compassionate.

original: 'di nyid bdag nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di nyid bdag nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs so //
translated: This is stated by the verse beginning with “one who is himself.

original: sdig pa ni mi dge ba bcu'o //
analyzed: sdig pa ni mi dge ba bcu'o //
translated: ” Sin is the ten unwholesome actions.

original: de dag spong ba ni ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de dag spong ba ni ldog pa'o //
translated: Turning away from them is turning away from sin.

original: yongs su rgyal bar bya ba ni goms par bya ba'o //🔽ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed /🔽'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lugs dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rgyal bar bya ba ni goms par bya ba'o // ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed / 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lugs dang mthun pa'o //
translated: One should become familiar with them.🔽The statement “with ignorance as condition there are volitions, with volitions as condition there is consciousness,” etc. , is in the forward order.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs dang mi mthun pa'o ;
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs dang mi mthun pa'o ;
translated: The statement “with the cessation of ignorance there is the cessation of volitions,” etc. , is in the reverse order.

original: / gzhan dag ces bya ba ni pha rol dag la'o //
analyzed: / gzhan dag ces bya ba ni pha rol dag la'o //
translated: Others means other persons.

original: yang dag par bskul ba ni yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //🔽bsngags pa brjod pa ni yon tan brjod pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bskul ba ni yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'o // bsngags pa brjod pa ni yon tan brjod pa'o //
translated: Exhortation means to encourage.🔽Praise means to proclaim their good qualities.

original: rjes su mthun pa ni yang dag par rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ni yang dag par rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: Congratulation means to rejoice.

original: de ni rtse mor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rtse mor gyur pa'o //
translated: That is the peak.

original: de bzhin bzod pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin bzod pa ni /
translated: Likewise, patience is

original: rang gzhan rten can @148b bden shes pa ;
analyzed: rang gzhan rten can @148b bden shes pa ;
translated: The knowledge of the truths based on oneself and others,

original: / chos mchog de bzhin sems can rnams //
analyzed: / chos mchog de bzhin sems can rnams //
translated: And the supreme quality is likewise the maturation of sentient beings.

original: smin byed sogs kyis shes par bya //
analyzed: smin byed sogs kyis shes par bya //
translated: One should know it by its characteristics, such as being based on oneself and others.

original: rang yang bden pa shes pa dang // gzhan dag kyang de la yang dag par bskul ba dang // de'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / rjes su mthun pa ni bzod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rang yang bden pa shes pa dang // gzhan dag kyang de la yang dag par bskul ba dang // de'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / rjes su mthun pa ni bzod par gyur pa'o //
translated: Patience is the knowledge of the truths based on oneself and others, encouraging others to take up that knowledge, praising it, and rejoicing in it.

original: bdag nyid kyang sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang ba la sogs pa dang / gzhan dag kyang de la yang dag par bskul ba dang / de'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / rjes su mthun pa ni chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang ba la sogs pa dang / gzhan dag kyang de la yang dag par bskul ba dang / de'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / rjes su mthun pa ni chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: praising it; and rejoicing in it.🔽Both of these are the supreme Dharma.

original: de gnyis ka ni de bzhin du bden pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te ;
analyzed: de gnyis ka ni de bzhin du bden pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te ;
translated: Both of these are the supreme Dharma.

original: bden pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa'i yul te /
analyzed: bden pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa'i yul te /
translated: The object of the truths of suffering, etc.

original: go rims bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang / spang ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang / spang ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom pa'o //
translated: is the object of the truths, respectively, full understanding, abandonment, realization, and cultivation.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa 'bras bu lnga la shes pa mngon sum du bya ba ni byang chub sems pa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa'i bar gyis so //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa 'bras bu lnga la shes pa mngon sum du bya ba ni byang chub sems pa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa'i bar gyis so //
translated: The full understanding of the five fruits, such as the fruit of the stream-winner, etc., up to the entry into the stage of nonregression of the bodhisattva, is the supreme Dharma.

original: de bzhin du sems can yongs su smin pa la sogs pa la gnas nas gzhan dag kyang de la yang dag par bskul ba dang / de'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / de la mthun par dga' bar byed pa'o zhes bya bas ni bzod par gyur pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can yongs su smin pa la sogs pa la gnas nas gzhan dag kyang de la yang dag par bskul ba dang / de'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / de la mthun par dga' bar byed pa'o zhes bya bas ni bzod par gyur pa dang /
translated: Similarly, having stood in the perfection of patience, etc., one should exhort others to it, praise it, and rejoice in it.

original: chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of patience and the supreme dharma.

original: de ltar 'dod cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu gsungs te /🔽sgrib pa med pa'i gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed nas dam pa'i chos gnas pa dang / sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'o //🔽de bzhin nyid gtso bor gyur pa'i le'u ni de bzhin nyid kyi le'u'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu gsungs te / sgrib pa med pa'i gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed nas dam pa'i chos gnas pa dang / sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'o // de bzhin nyid gtso bor gyur pa'i le'u ni de bzhin nyid kyi le'u'o //
translated: Thus, wishing, etc. refers to the result of the aids to penetration.

analyzed: bdud ces bya bar rtogs pa dang // sangs rgyas dgyes pa'i spyod pa ste //

original: rtags ni nyi shu 'di dag gis //
analyzed: rtags ni nyi shu 'di dag gis //

analyzed: drod dang rtse mo bzod bcas dang // chos mchog rnams la gnas pa ni //

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub las mi ldog //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub las mi ldog //

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: 'di dag gis nges par dpog cing rtogs par byed pas na mtshan ma'o //

original: gal te bstan pa'i don 'di la'am /
analyzed: gal te bstan pa'i don 'di la'am /

original: gzhan gang yin pa ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan gang yin pa ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'am gyi sgra ni ji ltar yang sta @149b rnam pa gang gis 'tshal bar bgyi zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //

translated: From among the many signs, first of all, Subhūti, whatever is the level of ordinary beings, and so on, is stated.

original: so so'i skye bo'i dang / nyan thos dang / rang sang rgyas dang // yang dag par rdzogs pa'i rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i dang / nyan thos dang / rang sang rgyas dang // yang dag par rdzogs pa'i rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis te /
translated: The four kinds of suchness are those of the ordinary man, the śrāvaka, the pratyekabuddha, and the samyak-saṃbuddha, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: rnam pa bzhi po 'di 'ang de bzhin nyid kyis zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po 'di 'ang de bzhin nyid kyis zhes brjod do //
translated: And these four kinds are said to be suchness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: 'di thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te //
translated: He says, “Because all these…”

original: ni'i sgra ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: The word “because” is the reason.

original: gang gi phyir 'di thams cad ni de bzhin nyid la gnyis su med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di thams cad ni de bzhin nyid la gnyis su med do //
translated: Because all these are nondual in suchness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad ni mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du ma grub pa'i phyir de dag ni de bzhin nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad ni mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du ma grub pa'i phyir de dag ni de bzhin nyid kho na'o //
translated: All dharmas, form, etc., are just suchness, because they are not established according to their characteristics.

original: bzhin nyid kyang gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: bzhin nyid kyang gcig kho na ste /
translated: Suchness is just one,

original: gnyis sam mang po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis sam mang po ni ma yin no //
translated: not two or many.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid 'di ni gnyis su med cing tha mi dad de gnyis su byar med cing ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid 'di ni gnyis su med cing tha mi dad de gnyis su byar med cing ma chad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this suchness is nondual, undifferentiated, indivisible, and unbroken.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: It is non-conceptual because it is free from the nature of conceptualization.🔽It is non-discriminatory because it is not the domain of conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'i de bzhin nyid de la chos kyi de bzhin nyid du 'jug pa'o //

translated: Thus, the suchness that has that characteristic is the entry into the suchness of phenomena.

original: ji ltar 'jug pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one enter?

original: de bzhin nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said: In suchness, etc.

original: gnas pa ni de la mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni de la mthong ba'o //
translated: Abiding is seeing it.

original: mi rtog pa ni yang dag par ro //
analyzed: mi rtog pa ni yang dag par ro //
translated: Non-conceptual is correct.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni log par ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni log par ro //
translated: Non-discriminatory is incorrect.

original: de bzhin du 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar yod pas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar yod pas 'jug pa'o //
translated: Thus, entry means entering in that way.

original: ji tsam gyis zhugs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis zhugs pa yin zhe na /
translated: By how much does one enter?

original: de bzhin du zhugs pas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhugs pas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said: Having entered thus, etc.

original: brjod pa'i rim pa zhugs nas so //
analyzed: brjod pa'i rim pa zhugs nas so //
translated: Having entered the stated sequence.

original: ji lta ba zhes bya ba ni ji tsam thos pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba zhes bya ba ni ji tsam thos pa'o //
translated: As it is means as much as is heard.

analyzed: thos nas kyang zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i 'og tu yang ngo //
translated: Having heard, means after hearing.

analyzed: de las kyang 'das nas zhes bya ba ni de nas dus phyi mar yang ngo //
translated: Having gone beyond that, means after that, in a later time.

original: nem nur mi byed ces bya ba ni gnod par mi byed ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: nem nur mi byed ces bya ba ni gnod par mi byed ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: One should not doubt, means one should not harm.

original: yid gnyis ni yid rnam pa sna tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: yid gnyis ni yid rnam pa sna tshogs pa ste /
translated: Doubt is a variety of mind.🔽That is not so, means that is not the case.

analyzed: de mi byed pa de nyid de bzhin de ni yang ma yin pa zhes pa ni the tshom mo //

original: de med pa ni the tshom du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni the tshom du mi byed pa'o //

original: rmongs par mi bye ces bya ba ni rtog pa med cing dgag pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs par mi bye ces bya ba ni rtog pa med cing dgag pa'o //

original: ci zhig byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: What should one do?

original: 'on kyang 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: de bzhin nyid kho na la ni gzugs la sogs pa thams cad yin zhes @150a * //

original: mos pa ni dad pas so //
analyzed: mos pa ni dad pas so //
translated: Faith is conviction.

original: khong du chud pa ni shes rab kyis so //
analyzed: khong du chud pa ni shes rab kyis so //

analyzed: rtags kyi gtso bo ni thams cad shes pa'o //

analyzed: yan lag ni gyin da zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs so //

analyzed: / thams cad de bzhin nyid kho nar shes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa las ldog pa yin te / de ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la /

analyzed: 'di ni mi khom pa zad pa ste /

analyzed: de dag de la rtags gsum pa'o //

analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /

translated: refers to oneself abiding in the ten virtues and

analyzed: rjes su sbyor ba ni mngon par zhen pa med pa la 'jug pa'o // de la gnas pa ni de dag la gnas pa'o //

original: de dang ldan pa'i ting nge @153b 'dzin de bkag pa'o //🔽ma yin zhes bya ba ni dgag pa dang / 'brel ba'i don te de yang gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i ting nge @153b 'dzin de bkag pa'o // ma yin zhes bya ba ni dgag pa dang / 'brel ba'i don te de yang gnas pa'o //
