original: de la re zhig bzhi ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig bzhi ni /
translated: The meditative development of the perfection of vigour is in relation to the four types of individual.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas ma bral bar gnas te zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas ma bral bar gnas te zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
translated: The meditative development of the perfection of vigour is in relation to

original: de dag phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba ni sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de dag phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba ni sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba'o //
translated: As for the passage beginning “The aggregates are called...,”🔽“application” and “consequent application” are “application and consequent application.”

original: de dang rjes su sbyor ba ni de dang lhan cig sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: de dang rjes su sbyor ba ni de dang lhan cig sbyor ba ste /
translated: “Consequent” means “together with.”

original: rjes su'i sgra ni lhan cig pa'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su'i sgra ni lhan cig pa'i don to //
translated: The word “consequent” has the sense of “together with.”

original: de ni mi gnas so zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni mi gnas so zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: “He does not abide in them” is to be supplied.

original: 'dir thar pa ni yum chen mo dag las 'di ltar stong pa nyid la gnas nas chos gang la yang dman pa nyid dam khyad par du 'phags par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir thar pa ni yum chen mo dag las 'di ltar stong pa nyid la gnas nas chos gang la yang dman pa nyid dam khyad par du 'phags par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Here, liberation is described in the Mother Scripture as follows: “Having stood in emptiness, one does not see any dharma that is inferior or distinguished.”

original: 'di las tshig gnyis kyis gsungs pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs la nyon mongs pa med par 'os na 'du 'dzi'i gtam la dga' ba ste /
analyzed: 'di las tshig gnyis kyis gsungs pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs la nyon mongs pa med par 'os na 'du 'dzi'i gtam la dga' ba ste /
translated: In this passage, the two phrases “he does not delight in conversation” and “he does not delight in distraction” refer to the side of affliction.🔽“Conversation” is a verbal action, and “distraction” is a mental action.

original: gtam gyi yul yin pa'i phyir 'du 'dzi la dga' ba nyid do //
analyzed: gtam gyi yul yin pa'i phyir 'du 'dzi la dga' ba nyid do //
translated: “Conversation” is so called because it is the object of conversation.

original: de nyid med de gtam tsam yin pa'i phyir gtam mo //
analyzed: de nyid med de gtam tsam yin pa'i phyir gtam mo //
translated: “Distraction” is so called because it is the absence of that.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: khyad par gyur pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa 'gog pa'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyur pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa 'gog pa'i rgyal po'o //
translated: It is the king of the cessation of defilement because it is distinguished.

original: de nyid gtam yin te mngon sum du bya ba ma yin pas gtam tsam yin pa'i phyir gtam mo //
analyzed: de nyid gtam yin te mngon sum du bya ba ma yin pas gtam tsam yin pa'i phyir gtam mo //
translated: It is talk because it is mere talk, since it is not to be realized by direct intuition.

original: 'di nyid kyi gtam gyi don ci rigs par 'dir yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi gtam gyi don ci rigs par 'dir yang sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of talk should be applied here as appropriate.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba la gnas pa dang ; bral ba ste /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba la gnas pa dang ; bral ba ste /
translated: It is the abode of the application of the aggregates, etc. and of their subsequent application.

original: de ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rtags te dgu pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rtags te dgu pa'o //
translated: This is the ninth sign in the cessation of the path of vision through the acquiescence in the knowledge of the teaching on cessation.

original: sgrib pa lnga ni rkun po ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga ni rkun po ste /
translated: The five hindrances are thieves

original: dge ba'i nor 'phrog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i nor 'phrog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they steal the wealth of the wholesome.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: 'di ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i rtags te bcu pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i rtags te bcu pa'o //
translated: This is the tenth sign in the cessation of the path of vision through the knowledge of the teaching on cessation.

original: dge ba'i chos ni tshogs te lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no//'di ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i rtags te bcu gcig pa'o// dmag des mi mthun pa'i gnod par byed pa'i 'thab mo'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ni tshogs te lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no//'di ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i rtags te bcu gcig pa'o// dmag des mi mthun pa'i gnod par byed pa'i 'thab mo'o //
translated: The army is the battle that destroys the enemy.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: 'thab pa yod na 'gog pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: 'thab pa yod na 'gog pa 'thob ste /
translated: When there is a battle, one attains cessation.

original: 'gog pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i @154a * //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i @154a * //
translated: Cessation is nirvana.

original: grol ba'o // de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: grol ba'o // de yang gang zhe na /
translated: And what is that?

original: lus dang gnas dang / longs spyod du snang ba'i rnam par rig pa rnams log pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang gnas dang / longs spyod du snang ba'i rnam par rig pa rnams log pa'o //
translated: The cessation of the appearances of body, abode, and enjoyments.

original: de bas na lus la sogs pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i //
analyzed: de bas na lus la sogs pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i //
translated: Therefore, one is without conceptualization regarding the body, etc.

original: grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas zhes bya ba'am /
translated: One does not abide in the application of the topics of villages, cities, towns, countries, districts, and royal palaces.

original: de la mig la sogs pa lnga'i lus ni grong ste /
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa lnga'i lus ni grong ste /
translated: In that regard, the five beginning with the eye are the body, which is the village.

original: dbang po'i grong nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i grong nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the city of the sense faculties.

original: lus kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir gnas ni grong khyer ro //
analyzed: lus kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir gnas ni grong khyer ro //
translated: The abode is the city because it is the basis of the body.

original: dbang po drug gis rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir grong rdal ni longs spyod de yul lnga'o //
analyzed: dbang po drug gis rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir grong rdal ni longs spyod de yul lnga'o //
translated: The town is the enjoyment because it is the object of the six sense faculties.

original: ljongs la sogs pa ni gnas kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: ljongs la sogs pa ni gnas kyi khyad par ro //
translated: The country, etc. are the particular abodes.

original: bdag dang bdag gi rnam par rtog pa zad pa yod na thar pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi rnam par rtog pa zad pa yod na thar pa ste /
translated: When the discrimination of self and mine is exhausted, there is liberation.

original: de'i phyir bdag gi rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gi rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Therefore, with reference to the discrimination of self,

original: bdag gi gtam gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag gi gtam gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “the story of self,” etc.

original: bdag gi ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bdag gi ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to the discrimination of mine,🔽he says, “the story of the minister,” etc.

original: blon po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so//'di man chad gtam gsum gyis ni ci rigs par bdag gi ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / longs spyod kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / gnas kyi rnam par rtog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: blon po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so//'di man chad gtam gsum gyis ni ci rigs par bdag gi ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / longs spyod kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / gnas kyi rnam par rtog par rig par bya'o //
translated: From here on, with three stories, one should understand the discrimination of mine, the discrimination of enjoyment, and the discrimination of abode, respectively.

original: gal te de lta de ltar gnas par mi bya na /
analyzed: gal te de lta de ltar gnas par mi bya na /
translated: If one does not abide in that way,

original: 'o na ji ltar gnas par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gnas par bya zhe na /
translated: then how should one abide?

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Otherwise, etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyi gtam la so sor brtag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyi gtam la so sor brtag par bya ba'o //
translated: One should investigate the very discourse on the perfection of wisdom.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: thams cad du chos nyid dang mnyam pa nyid du sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba dang ldan pa nyid du gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad du chos nyid dang mnyam pa nyid du sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba dang ldan pa nyid du gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should abide in the state of being joined with the equality of reality everywhere, and in the state of being joined with the subsequent state of being joined with that.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pas so //
translated: The phrase with attention directed to omniscience means with the thought of enlightenment.

original: 'di ni dbang po dang yul gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i gnas pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dbang po dang yul gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i gnas pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: This is the state of being free from the state of being joined with the state of being joined to the discourse on the faculties and their objects.

original: de ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i rtags te bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i rtags te bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: That is the twelfth sign of the path of seeing, the subsequent knowledge of cessation.

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: In the treatise, it says:

original: ser sna la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni yum chen mo dag las sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dag la spyod na /
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni yum chen mo dag las sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dag la spyod na /
translated: The phrase avarice and so on refers to the great mothers, where it is said:🔽When practicing the perfection of generosity, one does not abide in the application and subsequent application of the discourse on avarice.

original: ser sna'i gtam gyi sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas zhes bya bas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na 'chal @154b pa'i shes rab kyi gtam gyi sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ser sna'i gtam gyi sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas zhes bya bas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na 'chal @154b pa'i shes rab kyi gtam gyi sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: When practicing the perfection of wisdom, one does not abide in the application and subsequent application of the discourse on faulty wisdom.

original: de 'dir ni de dag 'thab mo dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang rgol ba'i gtam gyi sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas so zhes gsungs te /🔽ser sna la sogs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i 'thab mo'o //
analyzed: de 'dir ni de dag 'thab mo dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang rgol ba'i gtam gyi sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas so zhes gsungs te / ser sna la sogs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i 'thab mo'o //
translated: Here, it is said that one does not abide in the application and subsequent application of the discourse on quarreling, fault-finding, debate, and argument.🔽Avarice and so on are the opposing factors, so they are the quarreling.

original: mtshang 'dru ba la sogs pa ni gnyen po'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshang 'dru ba la sogs pa ni gnyen po'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Generosity and so on are the counteragents, so they are the fault-finding and so on.

original: gang gi tshe 'di gnyi ga la yang sems la stobs mnyam par spyod pa de'i tshe rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di gnyi ga la yang sems la stobs mnyam par spyod pa de'i tshe rtsod pa'o //
translated: When both of them are engaged in equal strength in the mind, then it is a dispute.

original: gang gi tshe gnyen pos mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyam chung bar byas pa de'i tshe rgol ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnyen pos mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyam chung bar byas pa de'i tshe rgol ba'o //
translated: When the antidote weakens the opposing side, then it is a debate.

original: rtsod pa dang / rgol ba de dag nyid kyang gtam ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa dang / rgol ba de dag nyid kyang gtam ste /
translated: Those very disputes and debates are also talk.

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are conceptual thoughts.

original: de la sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas pa'o //
translated: In that regard, one does not dwell in the effort of engagement and subsequent engagement.

original: mi 'byed pa ni mnyam pa nyid du shes pas so //
analyzed: mi 'byed pa ni mnyam pa nyid du shes pas so //
translated: Non-division is by knowing equality.

original: 'byed pa ni sna tshogs nyid du rnam par rtog pas so ;
analyzed: 'byed pa ni sna tshogs nyid du rnam par rtog pas so ;
translated: Division is by conceptualizing diversity.

original: / chos smra zhing mdza' bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba nas gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: / chos smra zhing mdza' bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba nas gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: From speaking Dharma and desiring to be friendly up to should be upheld is easy to understand.

original: 'di ni mthong ba'i lam gyi chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rtags te bcu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mthong ba'i lam gyi chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rtags te bcu gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the thirteenth sign of the Dharma knowledge of the path of seeing.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba nas lung ma bstan par rig par bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la ;
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba nas lung ma bstan par rig par bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la ;
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom, should train thus in the cognition of the all-knowing.

original: 'dis ni chos ni rdul tsam mi dmigs nyid /
analyzed: 'dis ni chos ni rdul tsam mi dmigs nyid /
translated: Here he says that the Dharma is not perceived even as an atom.

original: rang gis la nges pa nyid ces bya ba de gsungs te /
analyzed: rang gis la nges pa nyid ces bya ba de gsungs te /
translated: He says, It is certain for oneself.

original: des chos rdul tsam yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: des chos rdul tsam yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: He does not see even an atom of Dharma as real.

original: gang gi phyir ldog pa de ni rang gi sa la phyir mi ldog gam de lta ma yin zhes the tshom med de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ldog pa de ni rang gi sa la phyir mi ldog gam de lta ma yin zhes the tshom med de /
translated: Because of that, he is certain that he will not turn back from his own stage, or that he will not do so.

original: the tshom ni som nyi'o //
analyzed: the tshom ni som nyi'o //
translated: Doubt is uncertainty.

original: yang dag par zhum pa zhes bya ba ni spro ba med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par zhum pa zhes bya ba ni spro ba med pa'o //
translated: Depression is lack of enthusiasm.

original: mtshams med pa'i sems zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshams med pa'i sems zhes bya ba la /
translated: The thought of the heinous crimes is as follows:

original: mtshams med pa ni mtshams med pa lnga'o //
analyzed: mtshams med pa ni mtshams med pa lnga'o //
translated: The heinous crimes are the five heinous crimes.

original: gsal ba ni rnam pa thams cad du btang ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba ni rnam pa thams cad du btang ba'o //
translated: Abandoning is giving up completely.

original: gnod pa ni nyam chung bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa ni nyam chung bar byas pa'o //
translated: Harm is making weak.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sems ni bdag nyid phyir mi ldog pa nyid du nges pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sems ni bdag nyid phyir mi ldog pa nyid du nges pa'o //
translated: The thought of irreversibility is the certainty of irreversibility itself.

original: mi 'phrogs pa ni gzhan gyis mi bkri pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa ni gzhan gyis mi bkri pa'o //
translated: Unconquerable is not being led by others.

original: 'di ni rang gi sa la phyir mi ldog pa nyid du bstan zhing nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni rang gi sa la phyir mi ldog pa nyid du bstan zhing nges pa nyid de /
translated: This is taught to be the stage of non-regression, and is certain.

original: de ni mthong ba'i lam la chos shes pa'i rtags te bcu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mthong ba'i lam la chos shes pa'i rtags te bcu bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourteenth sign in the path of seeing, the Dharma knowledge.🔽The three stages are:

original: sa gsum la ni gnas pa dang / bdud kyi las dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang / @155a * //🔽bdag nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sa gsum la ni gnas pa dang / bdud kyi las dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang / @155a * // bdag nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba ste /
translated: the stage of abiding, the activities of Mara, and the non-difference of the Tathagata's speech.

original: gnas gsum ni sa gsum mo //
analyzed: gnas gsum ni sa gsum mo //
translated: The three stages are the three stages.

original: de la lhag par yang dag par nges pa ni /
analyzed: de la lhag par yang dag par nges pa ni /
translated: In that, the special certainty is:🔽If, having heard the Dharma of the profound sutras,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: one does not understand it,

original: rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
analyzed: rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
translated: one should know that this is the work of Mara.

original: 'di nyid du zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di la'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid du zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di la'o //
translated: In this very life means in this lifetime.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: This is not the Tathagata means as before.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de bzhin zhes bya ba 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de bzhin zhes bya ba 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The word that should be connected with the following thus.

original: de las gzhan du ma yin zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par byang chub par 'gyur ro zhes don gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba kho na'o ;
analyzed: de las gzhan du ma yin zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par byang chub par 'gyur ro zhes don gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba kho na'o ;
translated: The phrase it is not otherwise is understood to mean one will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: / sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'o //
analyzed: / sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'o //
translated: The phrase blessed by the Buddha means an emanation of the Buddha.

original: yod pa las na kho na nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: yod pa las na kho na nyid kyi don to //
translated: The phrase it is so means it is the meaning of reality.

original: 'di ni sa gsum la gsas te /
analyzed: 'di ni sa gsum la gsas te /
translated: This is taught on the three stages.

original: de ni mthong ba'i lam la rjes su shes pa'i rtags bco lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mthong ba'i lam la rjes su shes pa'i rtags bco lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifteenth sign of subsequent knowledge on the path of seeing.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas le'u rdzogs kyi bar du gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas le'u rdzogs kyi bar du gsungs pa la /
translated: The passage from Moreover, Subhūti up to the end of the chapter is as follows.

original: bdag gi lus kyang yongs su gtong ba ni 'tsho ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi lus kyang yongs su gtong ba ni 'tsho ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase I would give up even my own body refers to life and so on.

original: srog kyang yongs su gtong ba ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: srog kyang yongs su gtong ba ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: The phrase I would give up even my life refers to death.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa'i chos ni dam pa'i chos te stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa'i chos ni dam pa'i chos te stong pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase the Dharma taught by the Blessed Buddha refers to the holy Dharma, which is emptiness.

original: skyes bu gti mug can kha cig ni 'dor bar byed do //
analyzed: skyes bu gti mug can kha cig ni 'dor bar byed do //
translated: Some deluded people abandon it.

original: 'di ni bdag dang gzhan yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag dang gzhan yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because he has completely taken up both himself and others,

original: srog kyang yongs su gtong bar byed pa de ni gang sangs rgyas la dga' ba dang gus par byed pa de bzhin du chos la yang byed de /
analyzed: srog kyang yongs su gtong bar byed pa de ni gang sangs rgyas la dga' ba dang gus par byed pa de bzhin du chos la yang byed de /
translated: he gives up his life. Just as he has devotion and respect for the Buddha, so also he has it for the Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi sku'o zhes shes par byed pa'i phyir te bdag nyid kyang sangs rgyas pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi sku'o zhes shes par byed pa'i phyir te bdag nyid kyang sangs rgyas pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He has devotion and respect for the Dharma because he knows that the Tathagata is the Dharma Body, and because he sees himself as already a Buddha.

original: nyan thos chos ston pa la yang zhes bya ba yang mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos chos ston pa la yang zhes bya ba yang mtshon pa ste /
translated: He also has devotion and respect for the Dharma teacher, and this is also an indication.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / lha la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / lha la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: The Bodhisattvas, the gods, etc. are also indicated.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'di ni chos kyi don du srog gtong ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni chos kyi don du srog gtong ba ste /
translated: This is the giving up of life for the sake of the Dharma.

original: de ni mthong ba'i lam gyi lam la rjes su shes pa'i rtags bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mthong ba'i lam gyi lam la rjes su shes pa'i rtags bcu drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixteenth sign on the path of seeing in the knowledge of the path.

original: 'di 'dra'i skad cig bcu drug ni //🔽blo ldan mthong ba'i lam gnas kyi //
analyzed: 'di 'dra'i skad cig bcu drug ni // blo ldan mthong ba'i lam gnas kyi //
translated: These sixteen moments🔽are the signs of irreversibility

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dag yin //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dag yin //
translated: for the wise who are on the path of seeing.

original: zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is the summary.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i rnam pa dang / rtags dang mtshan ma gang yin pa de dag gsal bar byed pa'i le'u ni le'u'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i rnam pa dang / rtags dang mtshan ma gang yin pa de dag gsal bar byed pa'i le'u ni le'u'o //
translated: The chapter that clarifies the aspects, signs, and marks of irreversibility is the chapter.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel /
translated: Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines Commentary

original: slob @155b dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u bcu bdun pa'o /
analyzed: slob @155b dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u bcu bdun pa'o /
translated: Master Ratnākaraśānti's Ornament of the Essence, Chapter Seventeen

original: // / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / mthong ba'i lam gang gi phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dang grangs kyi khyad par bstan nas /
analyzed: // / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / mthong ba'i lam gang gi phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dang grangs kyi khyad par bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the signs and number of irreversibility of the factors conducive to penetration and the path of seeing,

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni zab pa yin pa de la gnyi ga yang brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni zab pa yin pa de la gnyi ga yang brjod par mi nus te /
translated: the path of cultivation is profound, and both cannot be expressed there.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos las /
translated: Therefore, in the treatise,

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni zab pa ste zhes pa 'di nyid de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas rang sangs rgyas kyis mi 'phrogs so zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni zab pa ste zhes pa 'di nyid de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas rang sangs rgyas kyis mi 'phrogs so zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
translated: The Bhagavat said from “Bhagavat” up to “cannot be taken away by the Pratyekabuddhas.”

original: bcom ldan 'das ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba ni tshig gcig gis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba ni tshig gcig gis so //
translated: “Bhagavat, it is wonderful” is one word.

original: ji zhig ngo mtshar ba yin zhe na yon tan chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te //
analyzed: ji zhig ngo mtshar ba yin zhe na yon tan chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te //
translated: What is wonderful? He says “great qualities,” etc.

original: yon tan chen po ni tshogs te mchog tu zab pas bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis su rgyun ma chad par 'bad pas thob pas so //🔽de nyid kyi khyad par shes par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir tshad ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan chen po ni tshogs te mchog tu zab pas bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis su rgyun ma chad par 'bad pas thob pas so // de nyid kyi khyad par shes par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir tshad ma mchis pa'o //
translated: Great qualities is the collection, because it is most profound, attained through uninterrupted effort for two incalculable eons.

original: grangs shes par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir dpag tu ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: grangs shes par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir dpag tu ma mchis pa'o //
translated: It is immeasurable because it cannot be known by others.🔽It is inconceivable because it cannot be known by the disciples and solitary buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva is the irreversible one abiding on the path of cultivation.

original: phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba ni //
translated: “Non-returning” means🔽

original: bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'o //🔽grangs las 'das pas mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'o // grangs las 'das pas mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: The irreversible is the one who is on the path of cultivation.🔽The infinite is the one who is beyond number.

original: mchog tu rgya che ba'i phyir mu med pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu rgya che ba'i phyir mu med pa'o //
translated: The boundless is the one who is supremely vast.

original: mi 'phrogs pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis kyang bzung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis kyang bzung ba ma yin no //
translated: The unshakable is the one who is not seized by the wisdom of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam zab pa'o //🔽rab 'byor gyis gsol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam zab pa'o // rab 'byor gyis gsol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: This is the profundity of the path of cultivation.🔽Subhūti said, Blessed One, if the path of seeing is like this, and the path of cultivation is like this, how should a bodhisattva who has entered the Great Vehicle train?

original: spyod pa ni nus pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni nus pa'o //
translated: Practice means ability.

original: ston kyang sems can gyi don du mi 'gyur ro zhes dgongs so //🔽de las ci zhig ston zhe na /
analyzed: ston kyang sems can gyi don du mi 'gyur ro zhes dgongs so // de las ci zhig ston zhe na /
translated: The thought is, Even if it is taught, it will not be for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de kho na'i slad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de kho na'i slad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: What does it show? It says precisely for that reason, etc., and so on.

original: kho na ni rim pa bzhin du sbyar te de'i phyir gnas shes pa'i 'og du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: kho na ni rim pa bzhin du sbyar te de'i phyir gnas shes pa'i 'og du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word precisely is to be connected in order, so after knowing the abode it should be seen.

original: zab mo zab ces bya ba ni zlos pa'i don te /
analyzed: zab mo zab ces bya ba ni zlos pa'i don te /
translated: The repetition is the meaning of profound, profound.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi dmigs pa ste /
translated: The abode is the object of observation of the path of cultivation.

original: shes rab khi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab khi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: And endowed with the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i rten zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rten zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “its support” is that.

original: ston to zhes bya ba ni bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: ston to zhes bya ba ni bstan par bya'o //
translated: “It is taught” means it is taught.

original: 'di ni rab 'byor gyis gsol ba btab pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rab 'byor gyis gsol ba btab pa'o //
translated: This is Subhūti’s request.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang // brtsams pa ni zhes bya ba ni dang por ston pa'o //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang // brtsams pa ni zhes bya ba ni dang por ston pa'o //
translated: “Having said this” and so forth, and “it is begun” is the first teaching.

original: shes par bya bar @156a * //
analyzed: shes par bya bar @156a * //
translated: “It is to be known”

original: 'dod ces bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam la sbyor bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod ces bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam la sbyor bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: means it is to be applied to the path of meditation.

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis zhal gyis bzhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis zhal gyis bzhes pa'o //
translated: This is the Blessed One’s promise.

original: des bstan bcos las //
analyzed: des bstan bcos las //
translated: In that regard, in the treatise,🔽It is said:

original: zab mo stong pa nyid la sogs //
analyzed: zab mo stong pa nyid la sogs //
translated: The profound such as emptiness,

original: zab pa de ni sgro 'dogs dang // skur ba'i mtha' las grol ba nyid //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zab pa de ni sgro 'dogs dang // skur ba'i mtha' las grol ba nyid // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: That profundity is freedom from the extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: de'i zab pa ni zab pa'i dngos po'i ste /
analyzed: de'i zab pa ni zab pa'i dngos po'i ste /
translated: That profundity is the profundity of reality.

original: gang gi phyir de zab mor 'gyur ba de yang stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa lam gyi dmigs pa zab pa ni zab ces bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de zab mor 'gyur ba de yang stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa lam gyi dmigs pa zab pa ni zab ces bya bar dgongs so //
translated: And the profundity of that is the profundity of the object of observation of the path, such as emptiness and signlessness.

original: de'i dmigs pa ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa ste //
translated: Its object of observation is emptiness and so forth.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa yang zab pa nyid de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa yang zab pa nyid de /
translated: Emptiness and so forth are also profound.

original: gang la sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: gang la sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: They are free from the extreme of superimposition and the extreme of denial.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhal gyis bzhes pa bstan pa'i phyir rab 'byor zab ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhal gyis bzhes pa bstan pa'i phyir rab 'byor zab ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the assertions of the Bhagavat, it says, “Subhuti, profound…” and so forth.

original: ji ltar snang ba'i chos thams cad ni med la /
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba'i chos thams cad ni med la /
translated: All phenomena that appear do not exist.

original: de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: The suchness that exists just as it is is emptiness.

original: de nyid ni mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: That itself is signlessness.

original: de rig pas mtshan ma 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rig pas mtshan ma 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By knowing that, signs are stopped.

original: de nyid ni smon pa med pa ste de rig pas khams gsum du smon pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni smon pa med pa ste de rig pas khams gsum du smon pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is wishlessness. By knowing that, one does not wish for the three realms.

original: de nyid ni mngon par 'du mi byed pa ste /🔽de dag kyang srid pa'i don du las mi byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽de nyid ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni mngon par 'du mi byed pa ste / de dag kyang srid pa'i don du las mi byed pa'i phyir ro // de nyid ma byung ba ste /
translated: That itself is non-conditioning.

original: de dag de las mi skyed pa'i phyir ro //🔽de nyid ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag de las mi skyed pa'i phyir ro // de nyid ma skyes pa ste /
translated: And that itself is non-arising, because they do not produce it.

original: rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa nyid shes pa'i phyir ro //🔽de nyid ni dngos po med pa ste //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa nyid shes pa'i phyir ro // de nyid ni dngos po med pa ste //
translated: That itself is unborn, because of the knowledge that it is essentially non-arisen.

original: rdzes su med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽de nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: rdzes su med pa nyid kyi phyir ro // de nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: That itself is insubstantial, because of its unreality.

original: de rig pas nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal mi skyed pa'i phyir ro ;🔽/ de nyid ni 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: de rig pas nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal mi skyed pa'i phyir ro ; / de nyid ni 'gog pa ste /
translated: That itself is free from desire, because of the non-production of the latent impulses of the afflictions through the knowledge of that.

original: de dag gi yang srid pa 'gog pa'i phyir ro //🔽de nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste //
analyzed: de dag gi yang srid pa 'gog pa'i phyir ro // de nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste //
translated: That itself is cessation, because of the cessation of their re-existence.

original: de'i bag chags 'gog pa'i phyir ro //🔽de nyid ni med par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de'i bag chags 'gog pa'i phyir ro // de nyid ni med par gyur pa ste /
translated: That itself is nirvana, because of the cessation of its instinct.

original: de dag gi zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po zhig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po zhig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is non-existence, because of the destruction of their aggregates with-outflows.

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is emptiness, etc.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba ni zur gyis zhus pa'i don to //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba ni zur gyis zhus pa'i don to //
translated: Subhūti said is the meaning of the indirect question.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The dharmas are emptiness, etc.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po dang / khams la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po dang / khams la sogs pa'o //
translated: The all dharmas are the aggregates, elements, etc.

original: byis pas gzung bar bya ba'i gzugs la sogs pa de ji ltar zab ce na rang nyid kyis dris pa ni /
analyzed: byis pas gzung bar bya ba'i gzugs la sogs pa de ji ltar zab ce na rang nyid kyis dris pa ni /
translated: How is that form, etc. which is to be apprehended by the childish profound? He asks himself:

original: rab 'byor @156b ji ltar gzugs zab ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor @156b ji ltar gzugs zab ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, how is form profound? etc.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The answer is: Subhūti, just as suchness is....

original: gang gi de bzhin nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi de bzhin nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Whose suchness is it?

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: He says in that... etc.

original: gsal bar bya ba'i phyir rab 'byor gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gsal bar bya ba'i phyir rab 'byor gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to clarify, he says Subhūti, in regard to what... etc.

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni gang gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid yod pa la ste /
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni gang gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid yod pa la ste /
translated: In regard to what means in regard to the existence of the suchness of form, etc.

original: brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: It is not other than the imagined form, etc.

original: 'di ni gzugs la sogs pa'i zab pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs la sogs pa'i zab pa nyid do //
translated: This is the profundity of form, etc.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The Dharma is the teachings on emptiness, etc.

original: yang dag par bstan pas dga' ste /
analyzed: yang dag par bstan pas dga' ste /
translated: The joy of the correct teaching is the joy of the disciples.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol ba ni bcom ldan 'das ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol ba ni bcom ldan 'das ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The request of Subhuti is the statement, “Wonderful, O Lord!”

original: zhib mor bya ba ni mkhas shing rig pas so //
analyzed: zhib mor bya ba ni mkhas shing rig pas so //
translated: The subtle is the discernment of the wise.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa ni bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa la kun du brtags pa thams cad mi rnang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa ni bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa la kun du brtags pa thams cad mi rnang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching of nirvana is the non-manifestation of all conceptual discrimination for the irreversible one who is situated on the path of meditation.

original: gzugs la sogs pa las bzlog pa de dag ni don dam par snang ba'i phyir ro //🔽de la mya ngan las 'das pas ni gzugs la sogs pa sgro btags pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las bzlog pa de dag ni don dam par snang ba'i phyir ro // de la mya ngan las 'das pas ni gzugs la sogs pa sgro btags pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid do //
translated: The opposite of form, etc. is the ultimate, because it is the object of the highest direct intuition.🔽Therein, nirvana is the liberation from the extreme of superimposition in regard to form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa las bzlog pas ni gzugs la sogs pa de nyid la skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las bzlog pas ni gzugs la sogs pa de nyid la skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid do //
translated: The opposite of form, etc. is the liberation from the extreme of negation in regard to just that form, etc.

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i zab pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i zab pa nyid do //
translated: This is the profundity of emptiness, etc.

original: de nas bstan bcos las /🔽nges 'byed yan lag dang mthong ba'i //🔽lam dang bsgom pa'i lam nyid la //
analyzed: de nas bstan bcos las / nges 'byed yan lag dang mthong ba'i // lam dang bsgom pa'i lam nyid la //
translated: Then the treatise states:🔽The path of preparation, the path of seeing,🔽and the path of cultivation

original: yang dang yang du sems pa dang // mjal dang nges rtog bsgom pa'i lam //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so ;
analyzed: yang dang yang du sems pa dang // mjal dang nges rtog bsgom pa'i lam // zhes bya ba gsungs so ;
translated: are the path of cultivation, which is reflection,🔽contemplation, and definite discernment.

original: / yang dang yang zhes bya ba ni rgyun no //
analyzed: / yang dang yang zhes bya ba ni rgyun no //
translated: “ Repeatedly” means a continuum.

original: de bas na rgyun dang ldan pa'i sems pa dang / mjal ba dang / nges par rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: de bas na rgyun dang ldan pa'i sems pa dang / mjal ba dang / nges par rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: Therefore, the path of cultivation is the nature of repeated reflection, contemplation, and definite discernment.

original: dmigs pa ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
translated: The object is emptiness, etc.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rten yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rten yin no //
translated: Emptiness, etc., are the support of the path of preparation, the path of seeing, and the path of cultivation.

original: gal te bsgom pa'i lam de nyid ji ltar yul yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bsgom pa'i lam de nyid ji ltar yul yin zhe na /
translated: If the path of cultivation is the object, how is it the support?

original: de ni rgyun chags yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni rgyun chags yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is the support because it is a continuum.

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni rgyun chags yin par 'dod de de la snga ma ni yul yin la /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni rgyun chags yin par 'dod de de la snga ma ni yul yin la /
translated: The path of cultivation is held to be continuous.

original: phyi ma ni yul can yin pas de ni 'gal ba med do //🔽'dir mdo ni bcom @157a * //
analyzed: phyi ma ni yul can yin pas de ni 'gal ba med do // 'dir mdo ni bcom @157a * //
translated: The former is the object, and the latter is the subject, so there is no contradiction.

original: ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, the sutra is from the statement of the Blessed One, and so on.

original: 'di skad ces bya ba ni ji skad du gsungs pa'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ces bya ba ni ji skad du gsungs pa'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is said means the emptiness and so on as stated.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lta bu dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lta bu dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Possessing such a perfection of wisdom means the perfection of wisdom that has attained the perfection of conceptualization.

original: mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa gsum zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa gsum zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means the path of seeing, the path of cultivation, and the three factors conducive to penetration.

original: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lta bu dang ldan pa ni 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lta bu dang ldan pa ni 'brel pa ste /
translated: There, possessing such a perfection of wisdom is the connection.

original: 'di'i gzhi shes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di'i gzhi shes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that this is the basis.

original: gang 'di dag sems par 'gyur nges par rtog par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang 'di dag sems par 'gyur nges par rtog par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be connected with “I will definitely think about them and contemplate them.”

original: ji ltar zhe na de'i phyir de bzhin du bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na de'i phyir de bzhin du bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: How so? Therefore it is said, “I will definitely think about them and contemplate them in the same way.”

original: gnas par bya zhes bya ba ni sems gcig tu nges par byas pas so //
analyzed: gnas par bya zhes bya ba ni sems gcig tu nges par byas pas so //
translated: “I will abide” means that the mind is made one-pointed.

original: bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mjal bas zhi gnas bskyed pas so //
analyzed: bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mjal bas zhi gnas bskyed pas so //
translated: “I will train” means that by listening to the scriptures, śamatha is generated.

original: bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges par rtog pas lhag mthong bskyed pas so //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges par rtog pas lhag mthong bskyed pas so //
translated: “I will accomplish” means that by contemplating, vipaśyanā is generated.

original: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gzhung thos pas so //🔽bstan pa ni don thos pa las so //
analyzed: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gzhung thos pas so // bstan pa ni don thos pa las so //
translated: “I will teach” means that by listening to the scriptures, śamatha is generated.🔽“I will explain” means that by listening to the meaning, vipaśyanā is generated.🔽“I will proclaim” means that by listening to the scriptures, śamatha is generated.

original: bstan pa ni gsal ba bsgrags pas so //
analyzed: bstan pa ni gsal ba bsgrags pas so //
translated: “I will elucidate” means that by listening to the meaning, vipaśyanā is generated.

original: rigs pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: rigs pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four reasonings:

original: ltos pa'i rigs pa ni rgyu thams cad la ltos nas 'bras bu skye ba'o //
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs pa ni rgyu thams cad la ltos nas 'bras bu skye ba'o //
translated: The reasoning of dependence is that results arise in dependence on all causes.

original: bya ba nyed pa'i rigs pa ni de dag las so sor 'bras bu'i khyad par bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba nyed pa'i rigs pa ni de dag las so sor 'bras bu'i khyad par bskyed pa'o //
translated: The reasoning of function is that from those [causes], the particular results are generated.

original: 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni tshad mas gang dag gi don sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni tshad mas gang dag gi don sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The reasoning of efficacy is the proof of an object by means of a valid cognition.

original: chos nyid kyi rigs pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis nges pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rigs pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis nges pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: The reasoning of nature is the nature of things that is ascertained by itself.

original: me nyid ni sreg par byed pa dang / chu nyid ni gsher bar byed pa nyid la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: me nyid ni sreg par byed pa dang / chu nyid ni gsher bar byed pa nyid la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, fire is by nature a burner, and water is by nature a moistener.

original: 'di dag gis ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa la skyil mo krung bcas te /🔽mi g-yeng bar gus par byed pa dang / rtag tu spyod pa ni sems pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa la skyil mo krung bcas te / mi g-yeng bar gus par byed pa dang / rtag tu spyod pa ni sems pa'o //
translated: By means of these, one sits cross-legged on the object of concentration,🔽and with respect to that, the mental attention that is always engaged is intention.🔽The mental attention that is always engaged is intention.🔽The mental attention that is always engaged is intention.

original: de nyid la zhi gnas rnam pa dgus sems mnyam par byed pa ni 'jam pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la zhi gnas rnam pa dgus sems mnyam par byed pa ni 'jam pa'o //
translated: The mental attention that is always engaged is intention.🔽The mental attention that is always engaged is intention.🔽The mental attention that is always engaged is intention.🔽The mental
