original: 'di ni dgra nyid yin pas na dgra ste bar du gcod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dgra nyid yin pas na dgra ste bar du gcod pa'o //
translated: Since this is itself an enemy, it is an enemy, that is, an obstruction.

original: de dag las 'das pa ni tshad med pa rnam pa bzhis so //
analyzed: de dag las 'das pa ni tshad med pa rnam pa bzhis so //
translated: Surpassing those is by means of the four immeasurables.

original: 'di ni thabs la mkhas pa dang bo'o //
analyzed: 'di ni thabs la mkhas pa dang bo'o //
translated: This is the first skill in means.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas mi ltung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas mi ltung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
translated: Subhuti, it is thus, for example, up to he does not fall down.

original: rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'o //🔽sa la mi ltung zhes bya ba ni brten pa dang gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'o // sa la mi ltung zhes bya ba ni brten pa dang gnas pa'o //
translated: Moving is going.🔽Not falling down on the ground is standing and remaining.

original: ci la mi rten zhes bya ba ni gnas pa dang brten pa la 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ci la mi rten zhes bya ba ni gnas pa dang brten pa la 'gog pa'o //
translated: Not relying on anything is stopping and depending.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa'o //
translated: “Abiding” means staying.

original: de la yang mi brten mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni thob pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang mi brten mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni thob pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: “He does not rely on that, does not stay there” means that he does not attain cessation.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni gnas pa la mi rten pa'o //🔽mi ltung ngo zhes bya ba ni gnas pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni gnas pa la mi rten pa'o // mi ltung ngo zhes bya ba ni gnas pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: “On that” means on the abiding.🔽“He does not fall” means that he does not abide, because there is no abiding.

original: mi ltung ngo zhes bya ba ni gnas pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi ltung ngo zhes bya ba ni gnas pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “He does not fall” means that he does not abide.

original: 'di ni brten pa dang / gnas pa bkag pas mi gnas pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: 'di ni brten pa dang / gnas pa bkag pas mi gnas pa'i thabs so //
translated: This is the method of non-abiding, which is the negation of reliance and abiding.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Subhūti, it is thus,” etc.,

original: mngon sum du mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: mngon sum du mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
translated: up to “he should not actualize it.”

original: bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' nyid la 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' nyid la 'jog pa'o //
translated: “Reverse” means to stop in space itself.

original: ltung du mi ster zhes bya ba ni ldog tu mi ster ba'o //
analyzed: ltung du mi ster zhes bya ba ni ldog tu mi ster ba'o //
translated: “He does not allow it to fall” means that he does not allow it to turn back.

original: mda' 'phangs pa'i shugs kyis yun ring por lhung du mi ster ba'o //
analyzed: mda' 'phangs pa'i shugs kyis yun ring por lhung du mi ster ba'o //
translated: The force of the shot arrow does not allow it to fall for a long time.

original: de bzhin du 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su ma smin par bar ma dor rtogs pa de sems dang sems gzhan gyi shugs kyis mngon sum du mi byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su ma smin par bar ma dor rtogs pa de sems dang sems gzhan gyi shugs kyis mngon sum du mi byed do //
translated: Likewise, this is the non-realization in the middle of the Buddha-qualities which are not yet mature, because of the force of mind and other minds.

original: de las 'da' ba'i tshul gyi shugs kyis thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de las 'da' ba'i tshul gyi shugs kyis thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The force of the method of transcending that is skill in means.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya @163b ba nas ;
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya @163b ba nas ;
translated: Having said this, etc.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
translated: up to: does not realize the limit of reality.🔽Practicing, etc.

original: spyod cing zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyis so //
analyzed: spyod cing zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyis so //
translated: means by means of serenity.🔽Abiding, etc.

original: gnas te zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gis so //
analyzed: gnas te zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gis so //
translated: means by means of insight.🔽Concentrating in samādhi, etc.

original: ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhog cing zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga dag gis so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhog cing zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga dag gis so //
translated: means by means of both.🔽I, etc.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni rang gis so //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni rang gis so //
translated: means by myself.🔽Accomplishing, etc.

original: mngon par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: means expressing.

original: ting nge 'dzin yang yin la rnam par thar pa'i sgo yang yin pas rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang yin la rnam par thar pa'i sgo yang yin pas rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: It is a concentration and also a door of liberation, thus it is a concentration which is a door of liberation.

original: grol ba'i sgo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grol ba'i sgo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a door to liberation.

original: sems bskyed pa ni sems mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni sems mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The generation of mind is the establishment of the mind.

original: 'dis na 'di dka' ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis na 'di dka' ba byed pa'o //
translated: By this, he does what is difficult.

original: de ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir thun mong ma yin pa'i thabs mkhas pas so //
analyzed: de ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir thun mong ma yin pa'i thabs mkhas pas so //
translated: Thus, by means of the uncommon skillful means, because of the uncommonness of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor nam zhes bya ba nas 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la sems can ni bdag dang skyes bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor nam zhes bya ba nas 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la sems can ni bdag dang skyes bu'o //
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, from “when” up to “attain” is stated. Sentient beings are the self and the person.

original: dbang po rnams ni tha dad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni tha dad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The faculties are the different ones, etc.

original: stobs rnams kyang lnga nyid do //
analyzed: stobs rnams kyang lnga nyid do //
translated: The powers are also just five.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams ni bdun nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams ni bdun nyid do //
translated: The limbs of enlightenment are just seven.

original: lam ni yan lag brgyad do //
analyzed: lam ni yan lag brgyad do //
translated: The path is eightfold.

original: sems can du lta ba ni chags pa'o //
analyzed: sems can du lta ba ni chags pa'o //
translated: The view of sentient beings is attachment.

original: sems can rnams kyis de spang ba'i phyir mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas dam pa'i chos bstan par bya'o zhes chags pa med pa'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i phyir ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis de spang ba'i phyir mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas dam pa'i chos bstan par bya'o zhes chags pa med pa'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i phyir ma chags pa'o //
translated: He is not attached because he has entered into the meditative absorption of emptiness, etc., without attachment, thinking, “I will fully awaken to supreme and complete awakening and teach the holy Dharma in order to cause sentient beings to abandon that.”

original: de dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ma chags pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ma chags pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: He is skilled in means that are not attached because he possesses that.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, from “the perception of a dharma” up to “attains” is stated.

original: chos kyi 'du shes zhes bya ba ni khams la sogs pa thams cad kyi 'du shes so //
analyzed: chos kyi 'du shes zhes bya ba ni khams la sogs pa thams cad kyi 'du shes so //
translated: The perception of a dharma is the perception of all the constituents, etc.

original: de ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: That is the objective support.

original: de dag spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: In order to abandon that, etc. is as before.

original: de yang stong pa nyid la sogs pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang stong pa nyid la sogs pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, that is the non-apprehension of emptiness, etc.

original: de dag dang ldan pa ni mi dmigs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa ni mi dmigs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: He is skilled in means that are not apprehended because he possesses that.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, from the beginningless beginning,

original: thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya pa'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya pa'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
translated: Moreover, it is stated in the passage beginning with “Subhuti, furthermore” and ending with “attains”.

original: bud med dang / skyes pa dang / gzugs dang sgra rnams ni 'du shes kyi mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: bud med dang / skyes pa dang / gzugs dang sgra rnams ni 'du shes kyi mtshan ma'o //
translated: The forms and sounds of women and men are the signs of discrimination.

original: de dag spang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa la snyoms par zhugs @164a * //
analyzed: de dag spang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no // de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa la snyoms par zhugs @164a * //
translated: In order to abandon them, as before.

original: pa ni mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: Similarly, one who has entered the signless meditative absorption is signless.

original: de dang ldan pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The skill in means of the signless is the possession of that.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
translated: Moreover, it is stated in the passage beginning with “Subhuti, furthermore” and ending with “attains”.

original: lha dang brgya byin dang 'khor los sgyur bar gyur cig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i srid pa'i longs spyod 'dod pa ni smon pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang brgya byin dang 'khor los sgyur bar gyur cig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i srid pa'i longs spyod 'dod pa ni smon pa'o //
translated: The desire for the enjoyments of existence, such as “May I become a god, Shakra, or a universal monarch”, is aspiration.

original: de'i rtsa ba ni phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i rtsa ba ni phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Its root is the four errors.

original: phyin ci log de ldang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log de ldang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: de ni smon pa ste de dang ldan pa ni smon pa med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni smon pa ste de dang ldan pa ni smon pa med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: That is the aspiration, and the one who possesses it is skilled in the means of aspirationlessness.

original: rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhuti, etc.

original: go skabs med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la //
analyzed: go skabs med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la //
translated: up to there is no opportunity, etc.

original: mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi yul bstan nas /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi yul bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the domain of the three doors of liberation, such as nonapprehending, etc.,

original: 'di'i mngon par 'du mi byed pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi yul rdzogs te /
analyzed: 'di'i mngon par 'du mi byed pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi yul rdzogs te /
translated: the domain of the special qualities of non-conditioning, etc., is completed.

original: da ni de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni de brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now that should be stated.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed par ltung zhes bya ba ni dman pa'i byang chub tu'o ;
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed par ltung zhes bya ba ni dman pa'i byang chub tu'o ;
translated: Falling into non-conditioning means into inferior enlightenment.

original: / khams gsum pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba nyid do //
analyzed: / khams gsum pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba nyid do //
translated: The three realms means cyclic life itself.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhuti, etc.

original: mi gnod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: mi gnod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
translated: up to because there is no injury.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa la dri bar bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'di ltar bsgrub pa dang / ji ltar 'dris par bya ba zhes gal te de skad ces 'dri na stong pa nyid la sogs pa nyid la bsgom pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa la dri bar bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'di ltar bsgrub pa dang / ji ltar 'dris par bya ba zhes gal te de skad ces 'dri na stong pa nyid la sogs pa nyid la bsgom pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattva who wishes to fully awaken to perfect buddhahood should ask the bodhisattva about how to accomplish perfect buddhahood and how to become familiar with it. If he asks in this way, he should be told to meditate on emptiness and so forth,

original: yongs su 'dris par gyis la mngon sum du ni ma byed cig /
analyzed: yongs su 'dris par gyis la mngon sum du ni ma byed cig /
translated: but not to actualize it.

original: de yang thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su mi gtong ba la sogs pa'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: de yang thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su mi gtong ba la sogs pa'i sems kyis so //
translated: Moreover, with a mind that does not abandon sentient beings through skill in means and so forth.

original: de ltar ston pa de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: de ltar ston pa de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags so //
translated: Thus, that teacher is a sign of irreversibility.

original: de'i phyir 'di la de'i rtags ston pa ni de'i rtags kyi thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la de'i rtags ston pa ni de'i rtags kyi thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, teaching that sign is the skill in means of that sign.🔽Subhūti said...

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas mi 'phrogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas mi 'phrogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
translated: up to...is not taken away.

original: byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa mang yang de ltar shes shing lan ldon pa gang yin pa de dag ni nyung ngo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa mang yang de ltar shes shing lan ldon pa gang yin pa de dag ni nyung ngo //
translated: But those who know and can explain this way, even though they practice for enlightenment, are few.

original: de dag ni phyir mi ldog par lung bstan pas //
analyzed: de dag ni phyir mi ldog par lung bstan pas //
translated: They are predicted to be irreversible.

original: lha dang mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mi 'phrogs te /
analyzed: lha dang mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mi 'phrogs te /
translated: The world with its gods, humans, and asuras cannot overpower them.

original: gang gi phyir nyung ba de'i phyir tshad yod pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyung ba de'i phyir tshad yod pa'o //
translated: Because they are few, they are limited.

original: 'di ni tshad med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshad med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: This is the skillful means of being unlimited.

original: de bas na de ltar @164b dgu pa'i phyed nas bzung nas //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar @164b dgu pa'i phyed nas bzung nas //
translated: Therefore, in this way, starting from the second half of the ninth stage,

original: nyi shu pa'i phyed snga ma'i bar gyi bcu gcig gis ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyi shu pa'i phyed snga ma'i bar gyi bcu gcig gis ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'o //
translated: up to the first half of the twentieth stage, the eleven stages are the complete realization of all aspects.

original: de'i 'og tu rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: After that, the peak realization should be explained.🔽Therefore,🔽its signs, increase,🔽stability, and the abiding of the mind,

original: de'i phyir / de yi rtags dang rnam 'phel dang // brtan dang sems kun gnas pa dang // mthong zhes bya dang bsgom pa zhes //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de yi rtags dang rnam 'phel dang // brtan dang sems kun gnas pa dang // mthong zhes bya dang bsgom pa zhes //
translated: called seeing and meditation,

original: bya ba'i lam ni so so la //
analyzed: bya ba'i lam ni so so la //
translated: are on the individual paths.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam bzhi yi //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam bzhi yi //
translated: The four types of conceptual thought

original: gnyen po rnam pa bzhi dang ni //
analyzed: gnyen po rnam pa bzhi dang ni //
translated: are the four types of antidotes.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin //
translated: The uninterrupted meditative concentration

original: log par bsgrub dang bcas pa ni //
analyzed: log par bsgrub dang bcas pa ni //
translated: is together with the wrong practice.

original: rtse mo'i mngon rtogs zhes bya ba //
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon rtogs zhes bya ba //
translated: This is called the realization of the peak.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis dang // yi ge drug gis 'di sngar mdor bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis dang // yi ge drug gis 'di sngar mdor bstan to //
translated: This was previously summarized in two verses and six syllables.

original: de la dngos po ni brgyad do //
analyzed: de la dngos po ni brgyad do //
translated: Therein, the entities are eight:

original: rtags dang / rnam par 'phel pa dang / brtan pa dang / sems kun du gnas pa dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po dang / bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: rtags dang / rnam par 'phel pa dang / brtan pa dang / sems kun du gnas pa dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po dang / bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: the signs, the increase, the stability, the complete stability of the mind, the antidote to the factors that are discordant with the path of seeing, the antidote to the factors that are discordant with the path of meditation, the uninterrupted meditative concentration, and the wrong practice.

original: log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba'o //
translated: The wrong practice is the wrong view.

original: de la rtags kyi dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de la rtags kyi dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: Regarding that, in terms of the signs, the treatise states:

original: rmi lam na yang chos rnams kun //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang chos rnams kun //
translated: Even in dreams, all phenomena

original: rmi lam lta bur lta la sogs //
analyzed: rmi lam lta bur lta la sogs //
translated: are seen as being like dreams and so forth.

original: rtse mor phyin pa'i sbyor ba rnams //
analyzed: rtse mor phyin pa'i sbyor ba rnams //
translated: These are the applications that reach the peak.

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis dag tu bzhed //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis dag tu bzhed //
translated: It is accepted to have twelve aspects.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rtse mor phyin pa zhes bya ba ni rab kyi mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rtse mor phyin pa zhes bya ba ni rab kyi mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: Having reached the peak means having reached the highest.

original: sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application is the application to omniscience.

original: yang rab 'byor gal te zhes bya ba nas rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang rab 'byor gal te zhes bya ba nas rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, if... should be known is stated.

original: rmi lam gyi nang na yang zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra bar mthong ba'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi nang na yang zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra bar mthong ba'o //
translated: Even in a dream means seeing all phenomena as like a dream.

original: mngon sum du mi byed do zhes bya ba ni rtags dang po'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du mi byed do zhes bya ba ni rtags dang po'o //
translated: Not actualizing is the first sign.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti... should be known as the characteristic is stated.

original: rmi lam gyi nang na yang nyan thos kyi sa 'am /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi nang na yang nyan thos kyi sa 'am /
translated: Even in a dream, not desiring the śrāvaka level,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa 'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa 'am /
translated: the pratyekabuddha level,

original: khams gsum la 'dod par mi byed pa 'di gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum la 'dod par mi byed pa 'di gnyis pa'o //
translated: or the three realms, is the second.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti... should be known as the characteristic is stated.

original: mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /🔽rmi lam gyi nang na yang gnyi ga'i dge 'dun gyi 'khor chen pos yongs su bskor cing /🔽bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs par mthong ba 'di ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la / rmi lam gyi nang na yang gnyi ga'i dge 'dun gyi 'khor chen pos yongs su bskor cing / bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs par mthong ba 'di ni gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, those who dream that they see themselves as the Tathāgata, surrounded by a great retinue of both saṅghas,

original: mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
translated: this is the fourth.

original: @165a * // rmi lam na yang nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags te /
analyzed: @165a * // rmi lam na yang nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags te /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, those who dream that they rise up into the sky,

original: sems can rnams la chos ston par byed cing /
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos ston par byed cing /
translated: teach the Dharma to sentient beings,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed cing /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed cing /
translated: perform the deeds of a buddha in other world systems,

original: dge slong dag mngon par sprul te /
analyzed: dge slong dag mngon par sprul te /
translated: emanate bhikṣus,🔽and know themselves to be the Tathāgata,

original: bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs par shes pa 'di ni bzhi pa'o //🔽gzhan yang zhes bya ba nas rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs par shes pa 'di ni bzhi pa'o // gzhan yang zhes bya ba nas rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
translated: this is the fifth.

original: rmi lam na yang bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: rmi lam na yang bdag nyid dam /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, those who dream that they see themselves or others

original: gzhan dag la gsod pa dang / bcing ba dang / mgo bcad pa la sogs par mthong na skrag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag la gsod pa dang / bcing ba dang / mgo bcad pa la sogs par mthong na skrag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: When he sees others being killed, bound, beheaded, etc., he is not afraid.

original: sad nas kyang 'di ltar khams gsum pa 'di dag ni rmi lam lta bu ste ;
analyzed: sad nas kyang 'di ltar khams gsum pa 'di dag ni rmi lam lta bu ste ;
translated: And when he wakes up, he thinks, “These three realms are like a dream.

original: bdag mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas de lta bu'i chos bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bdag mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas de lta bu'i chos bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni lnga pa'o //
translated: When I have attained manifest perfect buddhahood, I will teach the Dharma like that.” This is the fifth.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, up to “one should know” is stated.

original: rmi lam na yang dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sems can mthong nas //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sems can mthong nas //
translated: In a dream, he sees beings in the hells, etc.

original: 'di snyam du 'di nas bdag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing der /
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'di nas bdag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing der /
translated: And he thinks, “From here, in the buddha realm where I will attain manifest perfect buddhahood,

original: ngan song thams cad mi 'byung ba de ltar bya'o zhes bya ba ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: ngan song thams cad mi 'byung ba de ltar bya'o zhes bya ba ni drug pa'o //
translated: I will act so that all lower realms do not exist.” This is the sixth.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, up to “one should know” is stated.

original: rmi lam na gal te grong tshig par mthong na /
analyzed: rmi lam na gal te grong tshig par mthong na /
translated: If in a dream one sees a village burning,

original: sad nas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: sad nas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: when one awakens one should think:

original: ji ltar ngas rmi lam du phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags kyi mtshan nyid mthong nas /
analyzed: ji ltar ngas rmi lam du phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags kyi mtshan nyid mthong nas /
translated: “Just as I saw in a dream the characteristics of the signs of irreversibility,

original: bden pa 'dis grong tshig pa la sogs pa zhi bar gyur cig ces bya ba nas gal te zhi bar gyur na de ni rtags bdun pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa 'dis grong tshig pa la sogs pa zhi bar gyur cig ces bya ba nas gal te zhi bar gyur na de ni rtags bdun pa'o //
translated: by this truth, may the burning of the village and so on be pacified.” If it is pacified, that is the seventh sign.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas le'u rdzogs kyi bar gyis gsungs pa la ;
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas le'u rdzogs kyi bar gyis gsungs pa la ;
translated: Furthermore, it is said from “Subhūti” up to the end of the chapter.

original: gal te sems can la la mi ma yin pas zin cing non ba ni nang du zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te sems can la la mi ma yin pas zin cing non ba ni nang du zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If some sentient beings are seized and oppressed by non-humans, it is because they have entered internally.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyis brlabs byed pa ni gal te bdag sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis bla na med pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan cing mngon par rdzogs par byang chub la /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyis brlabs byed pa ni gal te bdag sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis bla na med pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan cing mngon par rdzogs par byang chub la /
translated: Regarding that, the bodhisattva's empowerment is as follows: If one thinks, “I have been prophesied by the Buddhas of the past for unsurpassed enlightenment and will fully awaken,

original: bdag gi lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag na /
analyzed: bdag gi lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag na /
translated: and my superior intention is completely pure,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la ji ltar mi mkhyen pa cung zad kyang med pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la ji ltar mi mkhyen pa cung zad kyang med pas /
translated: Since the Blessed Buddhas have no ignorance whatsoever,

original: bden pa 'dis mi ma yin pa 'di gud du song shig ces byas nas /
analyzed: bden pa 'dis mi ma yin pa 'di gud du song shig ces byas nas /
translated: by this truth, non-human being, go away!

original: gal te bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs des gzhan du song ba de ni rtags brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: gal te bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs des gzhan du song ba de ni rtags brgyad pa'o //
translated: If by that blessing of truth he goes away, that is the eighth sign.

original: thabs la mkhas @165b pa la dpyad pa ni yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas @165b pa la dpyad pa ni yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The analysis of skill in means is the thorough knowledge.

original: de'i don gyi le'u ni le'u'o //
analyzed: de'i don gyi le'u ni le'u'o //
translated: The chapter on that meaning is the chapter.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel /
translated: Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines Commentary

original: slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u nyi shu pa'o /
analyzed: slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u nyi shu pa'o /
translated: By Master Ratnākaraśānti, the one called Essence Supreme, from the twenty-first chapter.

original: // / yang rab 'byor de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ni bdud kyi las kyi le'u ste nyi shu rtsa gcig pa /
analyzed: // / yang rab 'byor de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ni bdud kyi las kyi le'u ste nyi shu rtsa gcig pa /
translated: Again, Subhūti, in that regard, and so on, is the chapter on the work of Māra, the twenty-first.

original: de dag gi skabs gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi skabs gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the context of those?

original: theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis 'bras bu sgrub par byed pa na log pa'i nga rgyal bskyed pa'i bdud mang po 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis 'bras bu sgrub par byed pa na log pa'i nga rgyal bskyed pa'i bdud mang po 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When bodhisattvas who are new to the vehicle are practicing the consecration of the truth in order to achieve the result, many demons who generate false pride arise for them.

original: de ni 'di'i skabs so //
analyzed: de ni 'di'i skabs so //
translated: This is the context here.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag tu bstan pa'i byin gyi rlabs so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag tu bstan pa'i byin gyi rlabs so //
translated: In regard to that, that refers to the consecration that was just explained.

original: brtson par byed do zhes bya ba ni bdud kyi rang bzhin gyi skabs bya ba de'i ched du spro ba'o //
analyzed: brtson par byed do zhes bya ba ni bdud kyi rang bzhin gyi skabs bya ba de'i ched du spro ba'o //
translated: One should be diligent means that for the sake of that context of the nature of a demon, one should be enthusiastic.

original: stobs ni spro ba dang nus pa'o //
analyzed: stobs ni spro ba dang nus pa'o //
translated: Power is enthusiasm and ability.

original: gzi brjid ni stobs kyi nus pa'o //
analyzed: gzi brjid ni stobs kyi nus pa'o //
translated: Brilliance is the ability of power.

original: brtson pa ni bdag nyid kyi nga rgyal mang pa'o //
analyzed: brtson pa ni bdag nyid kyi nga rgyal mang pa'o //
translated: Effort is the abundance of one's own pride.

original: brnyas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brnyas pa ni ma gus pa'o //
analyzed: brnyas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brnyas pa ni ma gus pa'o //
translated: Disparaging and so on: Disparaging is disrespect.

original: 'phya ba ni khong nas bzhad gad byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'phya ba ni khong nas bzhad gad byed pa'o //
translated: Scolding is laughing at from within.

original: 'thing slad byed pa ni yid kyis brnyas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'thing slad byed pa ni yid kyis brnyas par byed pa'o //
translated: Looking askance is mentally disparaging.

original: smod pa ni nyas par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: smod pa ni nyas par mthong ba'o //
translated: Slandering is seeing as faulty.

original: bshung bar byed pa ni skyon brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bshung bar byed pa ni skyon brjod pa'o //
translated: criticizing means to find fault.

original: lung bstan to zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: lung bstan to zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The word predicated is a reason.

original: nga rgyal bskyed pa par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nga rgyal bskyed pa par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for arrogance is generated, etc.

original: 'dir yang dag pa'i sgra ni thams cad de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir yang dag pa'i sgra ni thams cad de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, the word truly means in every way.

original: bskyed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: To generate means to produce.

original: 'phel bar byed pa ni sngon du 'gro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'phel bar byed pa ni sngon du 'gro bar byed pa'o //
translated: To increase means to precede.

original: ston par byed pa ni ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ston par byed pa ni ston par byed pa'o //
translated: To show means to demonstrate.

original: rgyas par byed pa ni rgya che bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas par byed pa ni rgya che bar byed pa'o //
translated: To expand means to make extensive.

original: 'byung bar byed pa ni mthong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar byed pa ni mthong bar byed pa'o //
translated: To manifest means to make visible.

original: de nga rgyal zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nga rgyal zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for that is arrogance, etc.

original: gzhan dag las sems lhag par mtho ba nyid du byed pa ni nga rgyal gyi spyi ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag las sems lhag par mtho ba nyid du byed pa ni nga rgyal gyi spyi ste /
translated: The general definition of arrogance is that which causes the mind to rise up above others.

original: de ni sngar bstan to //
analyzed: de ni sngar bstan to //
translated: That was taught earlier.

original: 'dir ni de dag gi khyad par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni de dag gi khyad par brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, their distinctions should be stated.

original: gad de dman pa las mtho bar sems pa de ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: gad de dman pa las mtho bar sems pa de ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: When the mind thinks I am superior in relation to an inferior, that is arrogance.

original: gad mnyam pa las lhag par sems pa de ni lhag par nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: gad mnyam pa las lhag par sems pa de ni lhag par nga rgyal lo //
translated: Pride is the elevation of mind that is greater than the equality of laughter.

original: gang khyad par du 'phags pa las nga rgyal ba ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: gang khyad par du 'phags pa las nga rgyal ba ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal lo //
translated: Pride about pride is the pride of one who is superior.

original: phyir mi ldog pa nyid ma thob par bdag gis thob po zhes sems mtho ba de ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //🔽gang yang phyir mi ldog pa'i yon ta @166a * //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa nyid ma thob par bdag gis thob po zhes sems mtho ba de ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo // gang yang phyir mi ldog pa'i yon ta @166a * //
translated: Arrogance is the elevation of mind that thinks, “I have attained the stage of nonretrogression,” when one has not attained it.🔽The pride of thinking, “I have the qualities of a non-regressor,”

original: ma yin pa la /
analyzed: ma yin pa la /
translated: when one does not have the qualities of a non-regressor,

original: bdag la yon tan yod do zhes pa de ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: bdag la yon tan yod do zhes pa de ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: is false pride.

original: de lta bu'i sems can chen po mthong na zhes 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sems can chen po mthong na zhes 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: When one sees such a great being, one should apply the following.

original: lhag ma ni de dag nyid kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: lhag ma ni de dag nyid kyi khyad par ro //
translated: The rest is the distinction of those.

original: bdud kyis bcings pa de nyid ces bya ba ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: bdud kyis bcings pa de nyid ces bya ba ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: The bondage of Māra is pride.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, etc.

original: ming ston pa ni ming brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ming ston pa ni ming brjod pa'o //
translated: The teaching of names is the expression of names.

original: zhan pa ni dbang po rtul po'o //
analyzed: zhan pa ni dbang po rtul po'o //
translated: Inferior is dull faculties.

original: dgon pa pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan dag go //
analyzed: dgon pa pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan dag go //
translated: The ascetic practices are the “forest dweller” and so on.

original: grong las phyi rol rgyang grags kyi pha rol du ni dgon pa'o //
analyzed: grong las phyi rol rgyang grags kyi pha rol du ni dgon pa'o //
translated: The forest is one league away from a village.

original: der gnas pa na dgon pa pa'o //
analyzed: der gnas pa na dgon pa pa'o //
translated: One who lives there is a forest dweller.

original: de bsod snyoms kho na za bas na bsod snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: de bsod snyoms kho na za bas na bsod snyoms pa'o //
translated: One who eats only alms is an alms beggar.

original: de'i phyag dar kho na gyon pas na phyag dar khrod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyag dar kho na gyon pas na phyag dar khrod pa'o //
translated: One who wears only discarded rags is a rag-robe wearer.

original: nyi ma phyed dang nye ba kho na za bas na /
analyzed: nyi ma phyed dang nye ba kho na za bas na /
translated: One who eats only before noon is a one-meal eater.

original: phyis mi len pa'o //🔽stan gcig kho na la za bas na /
analyzed: phyis mi len pa'o // stan gcig kho na la za bas na /
translated: One who does not eat after noon is a not-after-midday-eater.

original: stan gcig pa'o //🔽lan cig bting ba'i stan la rtag tu nyal bas na /
analyzed: stan gcig pa'o // lan cig bting ba'i stan la rtag tu nyal bas na /
translated: One who eats only on one seat is a one-seat eater.

original: gzhi ji bzhin pa'o //🔽chos gos gsum las lhag pa med pas na /
analyzed: gzhi ji bzhin pa'o // chos gos gsum las lhag pa med pas na /
translated: One who always sleeps on the first seat spread out is a first-seat-user.

original: chos gos gsum pa'o //🔽dur khrod dang nye ba khon na gnas pas na dur khrod pa'o //🔽shing drung khon na gnas pas na shing drung pa'o //
analyzed: chos gos gsum pa'o // dur khrod dang nye ba khon na gnas pas na dur khrod pa'o // shing drung khon na gnas pas na shing drung pa'o //
translated: One who has no more than three robes is a three-robe wearer.🔽One who lives near a charnel ground is a charnel-ground dweller.🔽One who lives at the foot of a tree is a tree-root dweller.

original: mtshan mo cog pur gnas pas na cog pu pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo cog pur gnas pas na cog pu pa'o //
translated: One who always sits is a sitter.

original: ma bkag cing go skabs yod pas bla gab med pa'o //
analyzed: ma bkag cing go skabs yod pas bla gab med pa'o //
translated: It is uncovered because it is not obstructed and there is an opportunity.

original: bal gos nyid gyon pa'i phyir phying pha pa'o ;
analyzed: bal gos nyid gyon pa'i phyir phying pha pa'o ;
translated: It is a mat because it is worn like a woolen blanket.

original: / zas nyung du za bas na 'dod pa chung ba'o //
analyzed: / zas nyung du za bas na 'dod pa chung ba'o //
translated: It is of little desire because it eats little food.

original: ngan ngon tsam gyis dga' ba ni chog shes pa'o //
analyzed: ngan ngon tsam gyis dga' ba ni chog shes pa'o //
translated: It is contentment because it is satisfied with just the bare necessities.

original: gcig pu nyid yin pas na rab tu dben pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pu nyid yin pas na rab tu dben pa'o //
translated: It is solitude because it is alone.

original: mthong ba'i chos 'di la skyes par gyur pa ni mthong ba'i chos so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos 'di la skyes par gyur pa ni mthong ba'i chos so //
translated: The present life is the present life.

original: de ston pa ni rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ston pa ni rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: It is taught by the teacher.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it taught?

original: khyod ni sngon yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: khyod ni sngon yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said: “You were also like that before. ”

original: yang gi sgra ni de'i phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni de'i phyir gyi don to //
translated: The word “also” has the meaning of “therefore. ”

original: byin gyis brlabs pa ni zil gyis gnon pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa ni zil gyis gnon pa'o //
translated: The consecration is the overpowering.

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyis yo byad bsnyungs pa 'dren par byed do /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyis yo byad bsnyungs pa 'dren par byed do /
translated: The ascetic practices lead to the austerity of few desires.

original: gzhu 'dren pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhu 'dren pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like drawing a bow.

original: rlom sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba 'di ni nga rgyal zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rlom sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba 'di ni nga rgyal zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The generation of conceit is the meaning of pride.

original: lhag ma sbyangs pa'i yon tan de lta bu dag yod do zhes bya ba ni rtogs sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma sbyangs pa'i yon tan de lta bu dag yod do zhes bya ba ni rtogs sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de nas yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de nas yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Then, the passage beginning “Subhūti, moreover…” is stated.

analyzed: ming gis byin gyis brlabs zhes bya ba la 'dir ming ci zhig yin zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ni nges pa'o //
translated: This is the certainty.

original: sems kun du gnas pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: sems kun du gnas pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: The mental state should be stated.

original: ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the meaning of “samādhi.”

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise declares:🔽Taking the four continents, the chiliocosm,

original: gling bzhi pa dang stong dag dang / stong gnyis gsum dag dper mdzad nas /
analyzed: gling bzhi pa dang stong dag dang / stong gnyis gsum dag dper mdzad nas /
translated: the dichiliocosm, and the trichiliocosm as examples,

original: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni //
translated: through the abundance of merit

original: ting 'dzin yongs su bsgrags pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ting 'dzin yongs su bsgrags pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: samādhi is proclaimed.

original: mdo las ni bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin bstan gyi /
analyzed: mdo las ni bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin bstan gyi /
translated: The sutra teaches the concentration through the abundance of merit,

original: mngon sum ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni ma yin no //
translated: but not through direct perception.

original: ji ltar zhe na gling bzhi pa dang / stong dang / stong gnyis dang / stong gsum gyi dpes so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na gling bzhi pa dang / stong dang / stong gnyis dang / stong gsum gyi dpes so //
translated: How so? Through the examples of the four continents, the chiliocosm, the dichiliocosm, and the trichiliocosm.

original: gzhung gang gis she na /
analyzed: gzhung gang gis she na /
translated: By what text?

original: bcom ldan 'das gang zhes bya ba nas mngon par bsgrub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang zhes bya ba nas mngon par bsgrub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
translated: The Bhagavat has said, “Whoever, etc., will accomplish it.”

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni thams cad la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni thams cad la'o //
translated: “In them” refers to all of them.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba la'o //
translated: “In them” refers to the similar ones.

original: chos nyid ni chos kyi tshogs sam ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos nyid ni chos kyi tshogs sam ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The reality is the collection of dharmas or the essence.

original: srang grangs ni srang gi tshad do //
analyzed: srang grangs ni srang gi tshad do //
translated: The measure of the scale is the measure of the scale.

original: tshad gzung bar zhes bya ba ni srang 'di tsam zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: tshad gzung bar zhes bya ba ni srang 'di tsam zhes bya bar ro //
translated: “To be grasped” means “to be measured by this much of a scale.”

original: ci ste 'di dpe gang gis yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di dpe gang gis yin zhe na /
translated: But if this is so, by what example is it?

original: bsod nams kyi tshad ni 'dzam bu gling la sogs pa'i tshad de /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshad ni 'dzam bu gling la sogs pa'i tshad de /
translated: The measure of merit is the measure of Jambudvipa, etc.

original: bstan bcos la yang nye bar gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos la yang nye bar gdags par bya'o //
translated: It should be applied to the treatise as well.

original: rjes su yi rang ba tsam la 'di tsam gyis bsod nams kyi tshad yin gyi /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba tsam la 'di tsam gyis bsod nams kyi tshad yin gyi /
translated: The merit is measured by the mere rejoicing, not by the concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin la ni ma yin nam zhe na /🔽rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams las rjes su dpag na bsod nams mang ba nyid na zhes bsams pas nyes pa med de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la ni ma yin nam zhe na / rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams las rjes su dpag na bsod nams mang ba nyid na zhes bsams pas nyes pa med de /
translated: But isn't the merit of rejoicing measured by the merit of the one rejoiced in?🔽If one infers from the merit of rejoicing, then the merit is great.

original: rjes su yi rang yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no fault, because he thinks, I will complete the merit of rejoicing.

original: de ltar mi byed pa la smad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar mi byed pa la smad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to criticize those who do not act like that,

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba la @171b sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba la @171b sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, When this was said, and so on.

original: bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba ni bdud kyis thabs mang pos spro ba med par byas pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba ni bdud kyis thabs mang pos spro ba med par byas pa'o //
translated: Blessed by Mara means that Mara, by many means, made him discouraged.

original: mi mnyam pa ni sgra las so //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa ni sgra las so //
translated: Unequal is from the sound.

original: mi 'tshal ba ni don las so //
analyzed: mi 'tshal ba ni don las so //
translated: Unknown is from the meaning.

original: ma mthong ba ni gus pas so //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni gus pas so //
translated: Not seen is from respect.

original: mi sems pa ni mngon du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi sems pa ni mngon du mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not thought is from not manifesting.

original: bdud kyi phyogs kyi dngos po bdud kyi phyogs su gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi phyogs kyi dngos po bdud kyi phyogs su gyur ba'o //
translated: The Mara side is the Mara side of Mara's things.

original: de lta bu ni sems can gyi don chen po 'joms par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu ni sems can gyi don chen po 'joms par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such a person destroys the great benefit of sentient beings.

original: bdud kyi gnas nas shi 'phos pa zhes bya ba ni bdud kho na dang de shin tu chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdud kyi gnas nas shi 'phos pa zhes bya ba ni bdud kho na dang de shin tu chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Death and transmigration from the abode of Mara means that it is Mara himself, because he is in complete agreement with that.

original: mngon par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'o //
translated: Accomplishment means production.

original: gang dis she na sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang dis she na sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: By what? By the generation of the thought, etc.

original: yongs su bsngos pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su yi rang ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsngos pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su yi rang ba'o //
translated: Dedication means rejoicing.

original: rjes su yi rang ba'am zhes bya ba ni 'ba' zhig ma yin zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'am zhes bya ba ni 'ba' zhig ma yin zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: Rejoicing means not only that, but also, it is said, in others.

original: gang yin zhe na rjes su yi rang ba zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽gang la gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang yin zhe na rjes su yi rang ba zhes bya ba gsungs so // gang la gang gis she na /
translated: What? In the rejoicing, it is said.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In what? In whom? In the Blessed One, etc. is said, and By what, Blessed One? etc. is said.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Having said that, etc.

original: rjes su yi rang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni brgya byin la ston pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni brgya byin la ston pa'o //
translated: The passage up to I rejoice is the teaching for Indra.

original: koo shi ka zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Kausika, etc.

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni theg pa chen po la zhugs pa'i rjes su yi rang ba'i phan yon no //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni theg pa chen po la zhugs pa'i rjes su yi rang ba'i phan yon no //
translated: up to for the sake of rejoicing is the benefit of rejoicing in the one who has set out in the universal vehicle.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dang po sems pa yang ngo //🔽rjes su yi rang 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dang po sems pa yang ngo // rjes su yi rang 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: By whoever, etc. is meant even the first thought of enlightenment.

original: rang gi rgyud la bskyed pa dang / sgrub par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la bskyed pa dang / sgrub par yang 'gyur te /
translated: It is not just rejoicing, but also arousing and accomplishing in one's own stream of consciousness.

original: rjes su yi rang ba yang nges par bsngo bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba yang nges par bsngo bar bya ba yin te /
translated: The rejoicing is also to be dedicated, because it is said in the noble Ratnamegha and elsewhere: The wholesome roots of rejoicing should be dedicated to supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: ji ltar rjes su yi rang bar byas pa de ltar bsngo ba yongs su 'jug par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su yi rang bar byas pa de ltar bsngo ba yongs su 'jug par rig par bya'o //
translated: As it is said in the noble Prajñaparamita: Just as the rejoicing is, so is the dedication to be understood.

original: ji skad du yum chen mo dag las rjes su yi rang ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
analyzed: ji skad du yum chen mo dag las rjes su yi rang ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
translated: As it is said in the noble mother scriptures: The wholesome roots of rejoicing should be dedicated to supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: de ltar bsngo bar bya ba yang sems kyis sems spyod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de ltar bsngo bar bya ba yang sems kyis sems spyod pa yang ma yin /
translated: Thus, that which is to be dedicated is not the mind's experience of the mind,

original: sems las gzhan du yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems las gzhan du yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: nor is it other than the mind.

original: de nyid rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid ni ting nge 'dzin 'di'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid ni ting nge 'dzin 'di'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: That very root of merit endowed with rejoicing is the objective support of this meditative concentration.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ni rnam pa'o //
translated: The dedication to perfect complete enlightenment is the aspect.

original: sems kun du gnas pa ni ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: sems kun du gnas pa ni ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The abiding of the mind is the essential nature.

original: @172a * // kun du gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: @172a * // kun du gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the essential nature of abiding?

original: sems ni 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems ni 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: The mind is not characterized by grasping,

original: gzhan du yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la ma yin pa'o //
translated: nor is it other than that, i.e., it is not in all dharmas.

original: 'on kyang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gnyis su med pa de lta bu la sems kun du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gnyis su med pa de lta bu la sems kun du gnas pa'o //
translated: However, the mind abides in suchness, i.e., non-duality, of all dharmas.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyen po dang bcas pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyen po dang bcas pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: The conceptions to be abandoned by the path of seeing together with their antidotes will now be explained.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: In this regard, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:🔽The conceptions of engagement and withdrawal,

original: 'jug pa dang ni ldog pa dang // gzung ba'i rnam rtog so sor de //🔽dgu yi bdag nyid ji bzhin yul //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ni ldog pa dang // gzung ba'i rnam rtog so sor de // dgu yi bdag nyid ji bzhin yul //
translated: of the object, and of the individual,🔽are ninefold, and are said to be

original: min pa'i bdag nyid dag ces bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
analyzed: min pa'i bdag nyid dag ces bya // zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
translated: nonexistent objects.

original: de la re zhig rnam par rtog pa ni gnyis su gzung ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig rnam par rtog pa ni gnyis su gzung ste /
translated: Among them, conceptions are twofold:

original: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni gnyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni gnyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the conception of the object is twofold.

original: ji ltar rnam par rtog pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par rtog pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How are they conceptions?

original: gang gi phyir de dag gi yul ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i bdag nyid la rtog pas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag gi yul ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i bdag nyid la rtog pas na /
translated: Because they conceive of objects that are not as they are.

original: rnam par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: They are called conceptions because they conceive of objects that are not as they are.

original: de dag gi yul yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi yul yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are their objects?

original: 'jug pa'i phyogs dang ldog pa'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i phyogs dang ldog pa'i phyogs la'o //
translated: They are the engaged and disengaged aspects.

original: so sor zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka'i phyogs la yang ngo //
analyzed: so sor zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka'i phyogs la yang ngo //
translated: The individual aspect is both aspects.

original: dgu'i bdag nyid ni dbye ba dgu'o //🔽sems can btags dang rdzas yod par //
analyzed: dgu'i bdag nyid ni dbye ba dgu'o // sems can btags dang rdzas yod par //
translated: The ninefold nature is the nine divisions.🔽Imagined and substantial beings

original: rnam rtog 'dzin pa dag du 'dod //
analyzed: rnam rtog 'dzin pa dag du 'dod //
translated: are considered the two kinds of conceptualizations that grasp.

original: so so'i skye bo 'phags byed pas //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo 'phags byed pas //
translated: Since they cause the ordinary and the noble,

original: so sor de dag dgu'i bdag nyid //
analyzed: so sor de dag dgu'i bdag nyid //
translated: each of them has a ninefold nature.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: gzhan rnam pa gnyis ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan rnam pa gnyis ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The other two kinds are conceptualizations that grasp, because they are conceptualizations that grasp.

original: ji ltar gnyis yin zhe na /🔽go rims bzhin du rdzas su yod pa dang / btags par yod pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyis yin zhe na / go rims bzhin du rdzas su yod pa dang / btags par yod pa ste /
translated: How are they twofold?

original: sems can gyi rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are substantial and nominal, respectively, because they are conceptualizations of beings.

original: de las dang po ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de las dang po ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi'o //
translated: The first of these belongs to ordinary beings,

original: gnyis pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: and the second to the noble ones.

original: de dag kyang so sor dgu'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de dag kyang so sor dgu'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Each of them has a ninefold nature.

original: ji ltar de dag 'dzin pa'i rtog pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag 'dzin pa'i rtog pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are they conceptualizations that grasp?

original: yod pa ma yin pa kho na la 'dzin par rtog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa kho na la 'dzin par rtog pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they grasp what does not exist at all.

original: ji bzhin ma yin pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o /
analyzed: ji bzhin ma yin pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o /
translated: What is not so is a conceptualization.

original: 'di nyid / gal te gzung don de bzhin med //
analyzed: 'di nyid / gal te gzung don de bzhin med //
translated: If the object of perception does not exist in that way,

original: de dag gi ni 'dzin par 'dod //🔽de ltar de dag 'dzin pa yi //
analyzed: de dag gi ni 'dzin par 'dod // de ltar de dag 'dzin pa yi //
translated: then the perception of it is asserted.🔽Thus, the characteristic of the emptiness

original: ngo bos stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ngo bos stong pa'i mtshan nyid do // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: of the apprehended and apprehender.

original: 'dzin pa'i ngo bos zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa yod pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i ngo bos zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa yod pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: The “apprehender” is the existence of the apprehender.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dag go //
translated: “Those” refers to the aspects of the apprehender.

original: rnam par rtog pa bzhi po 'di dag kyang yul gyi dbye bas so sor rnam pa @172b dgu ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bzhi po 'di dag kyang yul gyi dbye bas so sor rnam pa @172b dgu ste /
translated: These four types of conceptualization are each of nine types, based on the distinction of objects.

original: de la dang po'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de la dang po'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: With regard to the first, the treatise states:

original: ngo bo nyid dang rigs dang ni //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang rigs dang ni //
translated: Nature, type,🔽path, accomplishment of the branches,

original: lam ni yan lag 'grub pa dang // shes pa'i dmigs pa ma 'khrul ba //
analyzed: lam ni yan lag 'grub pa dang // shes pa'i dmigs pa ma 'khrul ba //
translated: knowledge, object, nondelusion,🔽opposites, antidotes,🔽realization by oneself, action,

original: mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po dang // rang gis rtogs dang byed pa dang // de yi las bya 'bras bu la //🔽'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can gyi //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po dang // rang gis rtogs dang byed pa dang // de yi las bya 'bras bu la // 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can gyi //
translated: and the result of that action🔽are the nine aspects of the conceptualization

original: rnam rtog de ni rnam dgur 'dod //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam rtog de ni rnam dgur 'dod //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: that engages the side of purity.

original: byed pa dang / de'i las dang bya ba'i 'bras bu ni byed pa dang / de'i las dang / bya ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: byed pa dang / de'i las dang bya ba'i 'bras bu ni byed pa dang / de'i las dang / bya ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result of the action of that is the result of the action of that.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa dgu ni 'jug pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa dgu ni 'jug pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The nine beginning with the reality of that are the side of engagement,

original: byang chub sems dpas blang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas blang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are what the bodhisattva should take up.

original: de las brten pa 'di ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de las brten pa 'di ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: The basis of that is conceptual differentiation.

original: des ni dang po'o //
analyzed: des ni dang po'o //
translated: That is the first.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Therefore, with reference to conceptual differentiation,

original: mdo las tshig rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: mdo las tshig rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: there are nine terms in the sutra.

original: de la dang po'i dbang du byas pa'i mdo'i tshig ni /
analyzed: de la dang po'i dbang du byas pa'i mdo'i tshig ni /
translated: The sutra passage with reference to the first is:

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol ba /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol ba /
translated: Subhuti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das sems sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba nas ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba nas ;
translated: Lord, a mind that is like an illusion, up to

original: spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
translated: it acts.

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i glang po la sogs pa'i sgyu ma'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i glang po la sogs pa'i sgyu ma'o //
translated: The illusion of an illusory elephant, etc.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang gang snang yang yod pa ma yin te de ni sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang gang snang yang yod pa ma yin te de ni sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Similarly, although other things appear, they do not exist, and so they are like an illusion.

original: de bzhin du sems kyang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir la 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems kyang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir la 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: So too, the mind does not exist because it has the characteristic of apprehending, and the characteristic of apprehending does not exist.

original: gzung ba med par 'dzin pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: gzung ba med par 'dzin pa mi rigs so //
translated: It is illogical that there is apprehension without an object.

original: gal te gzung ba'i dngos po ltar med ce na /
analyzed: gal te gzung ba'i dngos po ltar med ce na /
translated: If it is asked, “If it does not exist like an apprehended object?”

original: gal te shes pa la don snang bar 'gyur na ni gzung bar bya ba nyid yin na snang ba yang med de /
analyzed: gal te shes pa la don snang bar 'gyur na ni gzung bar bya ba nyid yin na snang ba yang med de /
translated: If an object appeared to consciousness, it would be apprehended, but it does not appear.
